After those first few pictures on the PowerShot, I realized they were much better than the 8 I had taken on the Rebel.I really like the "color accent" setting on the PowerShot which allows you to point the camera at a color in your view and set it as the color accent. Then everything else but that color turns black and white. I got some amazing shots this way.My sister ordered 10 photos ranging from 5x7 to 11x14, and now her friend wants some of them too.  Never had that experience with the Rebel, even with my best pictures.  Maybe my little PowerShot will now turn me into a professional photograper after all!

Reviews.Title: Great little travel camera
Reviews.Author: S. R. Raj
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with our camera.  It has just come back from a sightseeing vacation with us, and it met/exceeded our expectations.  It is much smaller than our prior camera...small enough to conveniently fit into a pocket or a purse. This meant that we had it when we wanted it (unlikely with our larger old camera).  The delay between pressing the button and the camera taking a photo is much less than my prior cameras, so we could often get the picture we wanted, instead of just missing it.  The quality (for tourist snaps) was great.  It also has an easy video feature.  Battery life was quite good.The only nuisance is that the battery has to be externally charged (you cannot just plug in the camera) which is another thing to carry around (although not too big).  There is no internal flash memory, so if your SD card gets full, then you are done.  This is not a significant issue since SD cards can be quite big these days and are pretty widely available.

Reviews.Title: Third PowerShot not a Charm
Reviews.Author: K. Gould
Reviews.Content: Over the last seven years I've owned two other PowerShot models (the SD960IS & SD630) and was generally happy with their performance. They provide decent pictures in a compact unit that could fit in my pocket with great battery life.I've been using the ELPH 330HS since Aug 2013 (a little more than two months) and the third time is not a charm. It seems the camera is unable to determine the battery charge level unless it's 100% full or dead. The other Canon models I've owned could stay in my bag for weeks and were always ready to take a shot. Not this model. Every time I want to use it the battery is dead.Maybe it's the Wi-Fi. I don't know. But I do know I should have returned it while I had opportunity.UPDATE: Nov 2013I returned the ELPH 330HS to Canon and they sent a replacement in a timely manner. They even included a new charger and battery. I was thinking perhaps I simply had a defective unit. However the issue still continues. How can the battery go dead within 5 days sitting in my bag?

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: bann
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional or even a hobbyist.  I just want a point and shoot camera that takes decent pictures.  The ELPH 330 fits that need.  My smartphone can take good pictures and it's hard to beat the convenience of always having a camera on my person.  Having said that, a real camera is faster and produces better results.  I've had this camera for about 10 days now and have taken around 100 pictures.  Not one has been blurry.  I can't say the same about my phone.I chose the 330 due to the positive reviews and I've had a PowerShot A70 for about 10 years which still works fine.  So far I'm very happy.  Considering it's about $200 less than what I paid for the A70, this is a very nice upgrade.  Hopefully it lasts 10 years too.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "melodious"
Reviews.Content: This camera makes it easy to take great pictures. It's very light, small and easy to carry on the go. I took this on a trip to Thailand and got many compliments on how great my pictures looked. I couldn't have been more pleased, especially at the price point, which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 330 replacement
Reviews.Author: N. Clipsham
Reviews.Content: Had trouble with another make with the lens extending. It died in it's youth. Bought this Canon model and found the picture quality to be superior, but dropped the camera (keep that wrist strap on at all times) which dented at the lens iris mechanism area. As expected, repair was much more than a new one from Amazon, so I got the same model new again. Has just the features I need. Love the low light level operation. I can get no-flash pictures without being told the "picture is out of focus, do you want to save it?"

Reviews.Title: Arguably the best value in Canons (if not the best Elph)
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: [Currently, I'm seeing this camera being sold in silver by Amazon (not the same as "Prime") for $120.  That's as good a price as you're likely to see for this camera, and certainly the "most Elph for the money."] Having purchased a couple of Canon Elphs from Amazon, my front page now greets me with a number of attractive new Elph "buys," even though I couldn't be more satisfied with the two Elphs (SD780, Elph300) that I currently own. The primary rationale for trading up to the 330 is: 1. Wi-Fi connectivity (an iPhone can quickly "spoil" you) ; 2. a zoom lens that's twice the power of either of my two discontinued models.I'm afraid those two reasons aren't good enough.  In a subcompact camera there are always trade-offs when moving to a telephoto lens greater than 5X.  As for wi-fi connectivity, too many reviewers are still complaining about connections less seamless than their smartphone cameras.Otherwise, the Elph 330 emerges as the best choice among current Elphs.  The clear-cut favorite among the experts--the Elph 110--may be more money than many point-and-shooters care to spend (the same with the Elph 320).  And the screaming values, like the 520 and 530 (unfavorable reviews from numerous owners) or 115 and 130 (less powerful zoom, 28mm rather than 24mm wide angle lens, poorer maximum aperture rating) simply don't measure up to the Elph 330.  If you can get it for around $130, it's currently the best bet in a Canon Elph.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Maureen T. Mckay
Reviews.Content: We have had an older version of this camera for 6 yrs and have truly enjoyed it. When we decided to replace the camera, I did a significant amount of research and was quite pleased with the feedback regarding this little camera. It is very user friendly, even for my husband whose hands are larger than mine and who uses this camera several times a wk. We have been very impressed with the quality and the price.

Reviews.Title: My Love
Reviews.Author: HighHeelMe
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on my honeymoon with me and it took the most amazing pictures. It's a great addition to my dslr and even better depending on the situation. It's so light weight and easy to use. The zoom is amazing. I also used the wifi transfer function and that worked well too but it does limit how much can be transferred at once so that was a bit of a pain.

Reviews.Title: WIFI A DISAPPOINTMENT
Reviews.Author: DS
Reviews.Content: I really like the size of the camera, the quality of the pictures it takes, the battery life.  What brings the rating down markedly is the WiFi connection (or lack thereof).  The reason I bought this camera was so I could easily wirelessly transfer pictures from the camera to my PC, only to find now that it is incompatible with my Windows 7 Home Basic Edition!  I thought that was a pretty common software, couldn't figure out why I couldn't get the camera and the PC to find each other, then finally saw the "warning" on page 118 of the instruction manual.  Come on, Canon, you can do better than that!

Reviews.Title: Great images with wifi capability
Reviews.Author: Dr. RATAN SINGHDEO
Reviews.Content: Pro:1.This camera has Excellent image quality inspire of deceptive size.First I could not believe the images out of this tiny camera can be so astounding.All reviews are right about image quality.2.Good built quality.3.Price drop makes it excellent choice.4.Up to ISO 1600 images are crisp.5.Punchy colours and sharp corner to corner images.6.Very fast and accurate focus.Good for my kids photography.7.No shutter lag.8.Zoom capability makes it more versatile.9.Good battery life under Eco mode.Con:1.WiFi setting needs little time.But transfer speed is good.Suggestion:For better battery life one has to put LCD setting to Eco mode,easily one can get 250+ snaps.I recommend this camera over high end P & S cameras.I personally use Olympus XZ1 and Fuji XF1,but images and usability of Canon Ixus 255 surpasses both.

Reviews.Title: great quality
Reviews.Author: ellissa
Reviews.Content: great quality however i feel as though there are too many gimmicky features.  takes great pictures.  easy to use. bye.

Reviews.Title: headline or summary - wow!
Reviews.Author: David Goodale "Dave G"
Reviews.Content: Startling good camera - excellent image quality and use of the 12 mpixels.  Sharp lens.  The buttons are not user friendly.  If you cant see them you cant use them.  And what is this idiot deal where one of the few accessible button choices you have is to record three second of video prior to your shot?  Wow!Still haven't explored the camera much.

Reviews.Title: Huge zoom range in a true compact + wi-fi
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short:  This is everything you'd expect in a super-slim Canon ELPH, but with double the zoom range, more wide angle and wi-fi for instant sharing.  And to top it off, the price has dropped low enough to make this a no-brainer.  Big zoom, good picture quality, tiny camera + great sharing features.  I can't see anything else worth buying on this side of a couple hundred bucks.Pros:  Great zoom range!  It goes from super wide 25mm to a nice long 250mm telephoto.  Great for travel or really anything.  The sensor is better than even my ELPH 100HS, which I was already impressed with.  This camera can do very respectable ISO 800-1600.  The wi-fi is great for sending images over to your phone to post on FB or instagram.  My wife does it all the time and this has become her new cell-phone camera.  iphones can do OK images, but you don't get the zoom range or  the quality you do with the ELPH.  Video is better than most camcorders.Cons:The only two modes on the mode switch are auto (which can be switched to P or scene modes through a menu) or Video snapshot, which takes 5 seconds of video with each picture.  I can't believe enough people would use that mode for it to warrant 50% of the mode switch space.  The other con is that the lens is SLOW at f6.9 at the telephoto end.  This means if you try to zoom in for a concert or whatever in low light, the pictures get really grainy since it has to use very high ISO sensitivity. That's honestly the case on all compact cameras with long zoom, though, so maybe not a con for this product but a tradeoff for this prodcut segment.  The wide end is f3.0 which is not bad at all, so indoor wide angle shots turn out well.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased so far
Reviews.Author: Mark Nemeth
Reviews.Content: I have owned an SD1000 ELPH for a long time, and have always loved it.. a very robust and functional point and shoot camera, but it is getting old and tired. I purchased this camera as a replacement. Most of the other reviewers have already covered most of the pros and cons, so I won't re-invent the wheel here, but overall, I am very happy with this camera. it has the same functionality as my dear old SD1000, with a number of significant improvements. The full auto mode is impressively smart, choosing flash/macro/shutter/focus with surprising intelligence. I took it to a party and took many clandestine shots in normal room lighting with the flash disabled, and aside for some motion blurs due to the low shutter speed, it delivered excellent pictures. Video is impressive at the lower resolutions, but I did have some issues with the full 1080p mode, getting some stutter-y video, but the 780p seems flawless. The 10X zoom is impressive, bringing outdoor shots in close. The quality of the images, to my untrained eye, are outstanding, with good color balance. I even was successful in setting up the wifi to transfer pix wirelessly to my laptop, and while I agree that the instructions are less than optimum, if you follow them closely, it is possible to make it work. Apparently the wireless functionality is only supported on Win 7 and 8, so if you have earlier OS's, it's probably not going to play nice. I would recommend this camera for anyone looking for a really compact pocket camera to just point and click and get good pictures with a minimum of fuss. Sometimes, simpler is better.

Reviews.Title: Still one of the best cameras out there in my opinion
Reviews.Author: Original Vidiot
Reviews.Content: I've owned the predecessor (the ELPH 300) for many years and have always been amazed at the quality of the pictures it produced. Not everyone was perfect but many of them were amazing. It was compact, ergonomic and just seemed to work for me. It's only drawback was the 5X limited zoom. This newer model comes with many features I could care less about such as Wi-Fi and wireless printing and connectivity to cell phones etc. I'm an old school kind of guy .... gimmee a USB cable, a PC and I'm good to go. Transferring pictures to my PC takes about 30 seconds. In any case, this is basically the same camera .... same 24mm wide angle lens, same 1080p video, same LCD screen, menus and controls. The main difference is the 10X zoom which is why I bought the camera.There is one other difference however and the reason why I removed a star from my previous camera's rating. The access cover that is removed for access to the USB port is an awkward design. A simple piece of plastic that snaps into place where the hand strap connects. It is anchored in the center and doesn't pivot naturally to access either the USB on one side or the HDMI on the other side. You have to force it to one side or the other to uncover the port completely. The hand strap has to be positioned a specific way or you can't get the cover off. Every time I snap it off and on I can't help but feel as though this snap/lock mechanism has a limited life cycle and will possibly give out one day. It's just an awkward design and one who's only purpose seems to have been to bring the cost down.On the other side though, it still takes the same great pictures :-)

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: norman
Reviews.Content: First daren's review was super.This camera satisfy s  everything  I needin a camera.I can carry it with me anywhere I goFast focus is greatGreat picture and many more plus's

Reviews.Title: Day, night, movement, wind, and snow - this camera can survive it all.
Reviews.Author: Sarah B. "Sarah"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera! I took it on a trip to Iceland where it was snowing, raining, etc and it worked with no issues (was not damaged by the elements). In addition, I was able to use it to take pictures of glaciers, waterfalls, etc really well. It captured the city at night really well - certainly better than any other camera I have had. In addition, it was able to take an okay picture of the Northern Lights whereas usually only super expensive cameras on tri-pods are able to do so. Overall, great experience. The different formats actually have an impact on the camera and can improve the photo.

Reviews.Title: Canon ELPH 330
Reviews.Author: Allan Prevo
Reviews.Content: I used the camera on a recent vacation. Found the camera takes great pictures and the wife likes it because she can carry it around in her handbag.  Only complaint is the multiple menu steps required to erase a photo.  I should have spent a little more to get a camera with a trash button.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: ron
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Canon power shot. I am very satisfied with features especially the 10X zoom.Perfect size .Love the silver color.

Reviews.Title: Great in low light!
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Irvin
Reviews.Content: I bought this just because the EDM show I was going to didn't allow professional cameras and my old Canon PowerShot is just really not that good. Went to my electronic store a few hours before I headed out, bought this and was very surprised. There is very little grain, starts up fast, it's a really good size, slips right in the pocket. The slow-mo video is fun to use. Here's a video from last night that I shot all on this camera with:[...]

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330 Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Helen
Reviews.Content: Love the camera - fits into a purse or pocket easily.  The only thing I wish it had was preset camera settings, ie sunset, underwater, etc.  I can do without the WI-FI settings, there are some pictures I don't want to end up on my FB page or on the internet.  But that said, I still love the camera and am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Shots! . . AWFUL software!
Reviews.Author: J. Burger
Reviews.Content: If you are buying the Elph 330hs for the wifi feature, be prepared to swear a lot. This software is the most UN-user friendly ever!The camera window app will not allow me to register the web services, so no wifi feature! The image browser won't open at all. It gets to 80% and closes. (I am using a 2 year old quad-core PC with Windows 7).Forget about getting help from Canon's website. It's a mega site with billions of pages...with very few of the ones you will search for.  Canon,Verizon, and Samsung should not be allowed to code software, because it almost always sucks.To summarize: great images, but the software is AWFUL!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot is a great all-around camera for the price and quality
Reviews.Author: Charles H. Pratt
Reviews.Content: +I liked the product, because of the quality, price, reliability+I read through a lot of reviews (PC Mag & Consumer Reports) and this seemed like the best one for my uses.+Everything about the camera is simple and sleek.  It is light, durable, and turns on quickly.  It is very easy to use.+I bought a case (Amazon Basics Compact Camera Case), 2 lithium ion (rechargeable Halcyon NB-4L batteries), and a freebie was 4GB SanDisk SD cardFew things about me+I regularly use cameras and for my needs this one is perfect.+I just got this, but after playing around with it, everything is great so far.+I am a cautious buyer and it took me about two weeks to decide on this camera.Few things to the buyer+Everyone should buy the camera case, extra batteries, and at least a 4GB SD card.+Check out prices on different sites.  I found my camera for $129, my case for $5, and my batteries for $12.+If you need a good camera, buy it. Newer models come out in March/April, so if price isn't an issue they might have made improvements, then wait.+I plan on seldom use of the video recording feature.+I plan on using this for at least 5 years, as Canon is one of the best companies out there.+I am not experiencing buyers remorse.Things I like+Optical zoom+Great picture quality for a compact camera+Built well+The reputation and research of Canon products+Camera comes with battery, charger, USB cord, disk, manual and a wrist strap (so you don't drop it).+++++++I will update once I put it through heavy use+++++++Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot Ever!
Reviews.Author: Monicab28
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the Canon Elph 330 this past week.  As a professional photographer, I don't like schlepping my expensive camera equipment around with me all the time, nor do I like having to take it on vacations.  I was looking for a Point and Shoot that I could take on my vacation to Disney World in May, 2014.  After reading quite a few reviews, and then hearing from someone else how great this little camera is, I decided to purchase it.It is a fantastic camera!!  I took pictures at Disney on Ice this weekend and they turned out beautiful.  A lot of point and shoots, don't handle taking pictures in the dark very well, but this little camera did a fine job!It takes a little time bit of time to get to know the controls as they aren't very intuitive, but once you figure them out, it's fairly easy.  If you are looking for a great, inexpensive camera, this is the one you should purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Fundamentally strong, but the bells and whistles need work
Reviews.Author: Brian Connors
Reviews.Content: So... here I find myself with what should be the flagship of the Elph line (the 5x0 series is a little too retro-90s cutesy for my taste). The 12Mpx sensor isn't the step down people would expect; on this level, anything over 10Mpx is probably beyond what the optics can handle, so stepping down from 16 was a sensible move. The long zoom is nice, even if it makes the camera's external lines a little awkward-looking. The picture quality is great, and the video side seems to be pretty good about reducing rolling shutter effects, at least if my test video on a ceiling fan is any indication. The slow-mo and (quarter-resolution) rapidfire shooting features are nice additions, but even at regular speeds the Digic 5 processor manages a respectable 2fps; among other things, this is the first camera I've ever had that enabled me to be able to safely get a shot of an amusing highway sign I've been driving by for years. Video mode is pretty nice, and includes 1080p shooting like the big boys, albeit only at 24fps. However, I did notice that it lacks live autofocus (a strange omission for a 2013 product) and although the optical zoom works while shooting, it's very slow; if you want responsive, buy a camcorder, I suppose. And the stereo sound seems kind of a gimmick at best, especially given the chance that a finger might wind up covering the right-channel mic by accident a lot. The usual selection of "creative filters" continues, including "stitch assist" for panoramic shots and some color tweak tools.I have to admit the ergonomics kind of bother me, though. In general use the camera is fine (although I think the complaints about the overly flat controls on the back are kind of a big deal), but for example you need to have a very specific (and rather awkward) grip to open the battery/card slot door without turning the camera on by accident. Also, maybe it's just me, but I'm not a fan of the 2012 reskin of the Powershot interface; the vertical "wheels" tend to hide information that used to be more easily seen along the bottom of the screen, making it a little frustrating to find a specific setting. But that's a fairly minor complaint; it's annoying, but not ultimately crippling. Also, discreet mode no longer exists, which means it's harder to use as a note-taking device.Now... the Wifi. I really think Canon dropped the ball on this; while it works fine with my iPod -- out of the camera, straight to Facebook or Instagram -- I can't get it to talk to my router at all, which means it's more trouble than it's worth to use it with my computer. A web browser interface (or at least publicly available protocol docs) would be rather nice as well, since not everyone wants to be tied to Canon's software. While I'm on the software issue, it might be worth noting that this camera seems to barely even be on CHDK's radar right now; it's a great point and shoot, but if you're a camera hacker, look elsewhere. You won't be shooting raw on this any time soon.Overall, I probably sound like I'm being harsher on the camera than the star rating indicates, and that would be fair. Overall, it's pretty nice for a point-and-shoot, and not backbreakingly expensive. Picture quality is excellent and the camera is overall pretty zippy, as might be expected from a significant processor upgrade, and if you have two hundred dollars to spend on a camera, this is pretty much right in the sweet spot.

Reviews.Title: Little camera with BIG features!
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: The Canon ELPH 330 HS has restored my faith in Canon. Simply, Canon makes the best low light digital cameras on the market. I purchased the Canon ELPH 330 HS after returning a Canon SX280 HS which has a know firmware issue that forces the video to shut down the camera altogether. I was very disappointed because I was after the telephoto feature.The ELPH 330 HS does everything it advertises. It turns out the 10x zoom was plenty, the photos are spectacular at night and in the day light. You may need to play around with the settings at first. I found that turning off the auto flash in dim light took a much better photo. The video feature zooms and doesn't shut down. I probably shouldn't have had to write that, but if you have been frustrated trying to use the SX280 HS video, then you will appreciate it.You won't be disappointed with the ELPH 330 HS. It's simple, the 10x lens is great, the video is good ... good rating only because the audio mic could be better, but it's fine. The controls are pretty intuitive. The photos are spectacular.I took this camera to D-Land for 3 days and used it continually, over 500 pictures and one video. When I returned home the battery had only gone down by one bar. That is phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: Stunning quality, tiny package
Reviews.Author: A. Staples
Reviews.Content: We got this camera to replace an older Canon model and could not be more pleased. The quality of the pictures -- indoors, outdoors, sunlight, low-light -- are fantastic. The clarity at maximum zoom is unbelievable. The rechargeable battery lasted three days of heavy picture taking (Yosemite National Park, Disneyland with kids) and recharged within a few short hours. The charger is very compact, making it easy for travel. The only downside to this camera is that it is so small, holding it takes some getting used to compared to the older Canon PowerShot models. I would purchase this again and have no hesitations strongly recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: excellent all around camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. Y
Reviews.Content: This camera is very light and takes excellent pictures.  It takes a while to familiarize yourself with all the "bells and whistles' butyou can start taking excellent pictures and video right from the get go.  I've used other elph cameras for years and this is clearly the best of them.

Reviews.Title: Audio is improved over prior models but very prone to wind noise
Reviews.Author: T. Tom
Reviews.Content: I am pleased to report that with the 330HS, the audio in videos recorded with it is cleaner than prior models. I had a 300HS before and the microphones were on the top of the camera, which was a problem since your fingers would often be covering them, yielding unusable audio. On this camera, the microphones are on the front, which makes a lot more sense and yields better audio.I've also heard of constant audio hissing issues in the PowerShot S110 model as well as some miscellaneous hissing/buzzing noises in the S100 audio as well. None of this is apparent with this 330HS as far as I can tell so far.Note however that wind noise can be VERY problematic with this camera so that aspect has not been improved at all (even with the wind noise filter feature turned on).The video quality seems about the same as prior models and I cannot comment on the still image quality as I mainly am using this for video. I also do not use the new Wi-Fi feature but do appreciate the wide angle 24mm lens as well as the built in image stabilization and autofocus, both which work well while you are shooting a video.As of the time of this review, it seems this Powershot is the one to get.

Reviews.Title: 10x in a small package
Reviews.Author: Kathy&David; "KD"
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a point and shoot pocket camera. Big improvement over my old Powershot 750 in the following areas: Very good quality resolution in low light (except at extreme zoom), really good stabilization. Crisp photos in shade have even more detail than the naked eye or view finder.  I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of photos taken through glass at the aquarium.Not perfect: As I had not played with video on my old camera I was surprised with how fast it goes through the battery charge in that mode. (Note: Battery lasts for a LONG time in photo only mode (hundreds of photos.) The hand strap that came with the camera does not have a slide adjuster to tighten on wrist which I love so I swapped it off my old camera. I read the manual but have not played with any of the features.

Reviews.Title: Too many bugs! Old technology
Reviews.Author: I. Pollak "ik"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my honeymoon. I had an old Canon Camera 6 years old and took good pictures but had only 4x zoom.The BEST thing about this camera is the zoom lenses. 10x is the bare minimum a travel camera should have this days.Now the complaints.a. When I was shooting landmarks, always the background colors (sky for example) always seems wrong! Something about color accuracy. The picture felt wash out.  Maybe is simple physics (installing such a long lense on such a small camera) but are no doing it goodb. Battery Bug. Some days when a got to some landmark destination, I started shooting pictures. Maybe after 30 pictures the battery simply died!!!!! Amazing, so the rest of the day I had to take pictures with my cell phone, on my honeymoon! Even thought I bought this camera specially for this trip!  After some very frustrating day trips, I found out that by removing the battery for some minutes and putting it back on, the camera will restart and the battery really was still completely full!!!!  It a stupid and annoying bug!c. Old User Interfase. Come on!!!!  It seems an old NOKIA phone compared to an IPHONE! The UI is even worse than my old Canon Elph camera that at least had a dial wheel. In the days of touchphones and friendly UIs Canon is still graving to the past!d. Panorama shot.  Welcome to the 90s. Once again compared to a simple android phone, the Panorama mode is simply stupid! It's not like Sony Swipe Panorama. You move the camera and you shoot the next  picture!  I think the camera gives you a previo of the panorama, but actually it doesn't stitch the picture!!!! You have to do it with a PC software!!!All in all I can believe how little Canon has done in 6 years. I am really dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: Just what I want.. in small package
Reviews.Author: S. Tong
Reviews.Content: Carrying a DSLR camera with lens and other items around is not fun. I have been thinking of getting a compact camera for some time, but wife insists it would just be a waste of money.. Well, well this Cannon PS 330 was on sales for $179, I ordered it without telling my wife. It is compact fits in my pocket! Picture quality is good. Of course, you cannot expect it to take great pictures like a DSLR, but the pictures are still great. After playing with it for a few days, I took it to a birthday party to see if wife likes it. Initially she was mad that i 'wasted' money again. But after I let her used it for the rest of the day, she was convinced and liked the small the form factor of the camera and the quality of pictures. After a few weeks, she uses it exclusively whenever we go out with the kid. Great buy and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Ladd
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a cruise I was taking. It is a great very small camera to take along on trips you can put it in a pocket or purse. No trouble to take along anywhere. . It takes great pictures. and is easy to use. I would definitely recommend it to anyone. I used the 10x Optical imaging to shot far away pictures. It worked very well. Everyone raved about the pictures I took on this trip.

Reviews.Title: A versatile travel camera
Reviews.Author: Marc O'Polo
Reviews.Content: This ELPH 330HS was purchased to replace a Canon PowerShot A540. The 330HS is a nice travel camera. My wife uses it as a point-and-shoot; she likes it because most of the controls are similar to those of the A540 with which she is familiar. It is also half the thickness of the A540 and so fits better in her purse. I like it because of it's programmable features, it's 10X zoom and low-light sensitivity. The latter, in particular, is a handy feature since I often shoot under ambient light. (However, note that low light sensitivity is not necessarily achieved in the Auto mode; you have to switch to Program mode and manually select a higher ISO setting.) This makes the 330HS a good complement to my other camera (a Canon EOS 60D DSLR). The 330HS is handy when attending family activities, particularly when I want to have some of the flexibility of my DSLR without the bulk and weight.A couple of observations: The kit sold here on Amazon is complete and identical to that described on the Canon website. However, what is not mentioned on either the Canon site or in the Amazon description is that the kit does not include a memory card. I thought at first that my kit was missing that necessary component...until I read the instruction manual. Fortunately, I had a spare card from my DSLR. So be sure to order a suitable card at the same time you order your camera. This camera uses a SD, a SDHC or a SCXC card. I'm using a SDHC.Another point that has been noted elsewhere: There is a small switch on the back (upper right corner) that determines whether or not a short (few second) video clip is taken each time a still photo is taken. Canon calls it "Hybrid Auto Mode". I've chosen to toggle off this function. From a personal perspective, that short video clip is not helpful to the way in which I take photos.I did consider the 340HS which has just been released by Canon. However, some professional reviewers suggested that there are not enough differences between the 340HS and the 330HS to justify the higher price of the former. Also, the 12X zoom of the 340HS may look good on paper, but it's not a useful feature in the absence of a tripod; holding a camera steady at extreme zoom ranges is problematic at best.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Moses "trini boy"
Reviews.Content: I have always used Canon cameras with my last being a Powershot A540, a reliable camera during its time. I decided to upgrade last year to this unit and after reading the reviews decided this would fit the bill. Whilst the camera has created some brilliant shots I have three main issues that make it unnerving to use the camera.1. There is a major battery issue, on vacation planning to use the camera and ensuring it was fully charged before use, I experence a total failure. The display reads "Charge the battery" and only after eight shots. Take it off put it back on and it shows battery full.Then I have to play that game continuously. Thank goodness I had a backup camera.2. The WiFi is region specific. I am based in the Caribbean and was looking forward to this feature in particular, lo and behold when I attempt to install I am told it is not for my region. What rubbish...............3. On using the camera on Auto mode for low light mode shots I get the most terrible shots. I had to fiddle around to get the correct mode in manual to take the shot. The worst , and to my angst , my iphone snapped up the shot easy like Sunday morning.I am extremely disappointed in this unit and would not recommend to anyone, too problematic for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: IN LOVE!
Reviews.Author: HParkes
Reviews.Content: My fiancé has an older model and I love the video/still image aspect.  We bought my parents one for Xmas and I was so impressed that as soon as I had the funds, I bought myself one.  Its small and perfect for my small hands.  I now carry it in my purse and its my go to instead of my phone.Function wise, it is extremely easy to use!  Easier than my phone!Quality wise, I'm totally hooked!  I had a few test images printed up about a week ago to see the quality of an 8X10 print.  A friend of mine is using my camera to do my wedding pics!  I was that happy with the quality!

Reviews.Title: Batterie malfunctioning‎!
Reviews.Author: Diego Malagueta
Reviews.Content: I'm very disapointed with CANON. I've had other Canon's and was very pleased, but something is wrong with this model project.I can garantte that is the model because I've bought 2 of them, one for me and other for my mother.Both of them has the same problem with batteries (original batteries):- many times the camera indicates "change the batterie", but in fact is a conection (contact) problem! I take it out, put it in again, and it works. This happens A LOT!- the batterie ends VERY QUICKLY!!!

Reviews.Title: An amazing camera AAA+
Reviews.Author: The End Zone
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera.I own a bar. I have tried other cameras and none really performed well without a flash. But this camera takes truly amazing low light photos. It is also very easy to use and has amazing settings pre - programed into it including a snow & firework mode. It also has a very fast shutter in High Speed Burst Mode.Bottom Line an Amazing Camera at a Great Price

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Carol Ann Beggs
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our HR department to take employee photo's.  After research, based on the ratings this camera was the best fit for us for under $200. I can say it does not disappoint.  Very clear picture, easy to operate and really fast shutter speed.  Much smaller than I expected, but easy to handle.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: CR
Reviews.Content: We went from a very expensive camera back to this point and shoot camera.  It takes excellent pictures even compared to our powerful zoom lens camera.  We have bought two within the last month.

Reviews.Title: Very Very Happy!
Reviews.Author: Karin L.
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying I own two of the Elph 110 cameras ( blue and light pink) which take incredible pics. Was looking to get a camera with slightly more zoom for the times I need it. I was planning on purchasing the newer elph 340 in purple but after reading both tech reviews and customer reviews on various sites, I reconsidered. The sensor and aperture on the new 340 doesn't compare to the Digic 5 on the 330. So.. I purchased the elph 330 in pink ( at a premium price -for the color) and am very happy I did. The pictures I took in a rather dark restaurant turned out fabulous. I actually waited til I received my prints to review this camera. The prints were as great as the images appeared on the camera screen and computer. The images are sharp, clear and the color is great. I'm not a photographer and almost always use my cameras in Auto and the 330 is perfect. Love the hot pink color and love the great pictures. Get this camera before its gone!UPDATE:After using this camera almost every weekend for the past month I can honestly say this is the best camera I ever used. Every picture has come out clear and beautiful. Am actually considering buying another ( have the pink) I originally paid $280 for the pink but returned it when the price was $179. Now the pink is over $350!! I guess supply and demand. May end up getting one in silver if the price of the pink doesn't drop! Love the camera

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShop ELPH330 12MP Digital Camera.
Reviews.Author: Billie Jean Brickey
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised and how quickly this item arrived and how easy it is to use.  Must say I am delighted with the ability to have a stable zoom which eliminates blurry pictures.

Reviews.Title: A neat, pocket camera by Canon
Reviews.Author: Dewitt Whittington "Kitplane Builder"
Reviews.Content: I've been using a Canon S95 for several years and really love it. My girlfriend needed a new small camera (she gave here previous Canon ELPH away to a friend in Argentina) so I decided to get her the Canon ELPH 330. It takes amazingly good photos in low light, is easy to operate. Of course, it helps to read the manual a bit since it has so many features! The 10x zoom is very handy; the S95 only had 3x zoom. And, since it uses the ubiquitous SD memory card, I already had a number which I could use in the camera. I do find the battery a bit more of a hassle to replace since you have to pull a small, orange, plastic lever aside (or use the edge of the battery) to get the battery to slide into its slot. The S95 battery is quicker and easier to replace. But that's a minor point.Oh, the video this camera shoots is excellent. The biggest problem for me is holding the camera steady during a video shoot. One idea I read about and works for me is to use the Canon 330 with a monopod. Mine collapses to only 18"  and when extended, I can tuck the bottom end behind my belt for a steady platform for shooting video. Just like I used to with my Flip camcorder.Battery life is good, but not great. But one tip I'll pass on is the "real" Canon batteries last much longer than the cheapie ones you can buy for less, sometime much less. At least that's my experience. It's worth it to by an original equipment replacement battery.So, all in all, a great camera to have in your pocket ready to go. You can't take photos of interesting scenes and actions if you don't have your camera with you...with this one, you have no excuse not to take it with you all the time.

Reviews.Title: I really like this little point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: Tinypaws "Tinypaws"
Reviews.Content: I read literally hundreds of reviews before I chose this camera.  I thought it would have a fast shutter speed but I was disappointed when I used it for the first time.  Mind you, I think that is my too high expectations as apparently no point and shoot cameras have a fast shutter speed.  Apart from that, I am pleased with this camera.  I love it's tiny size (and I have big hands) and don't find it hard to operate at all with large hands.  The videos are a bit jerky but I've bought a faster memory card and I think that will take care of that problem.  The colour and clarity of the photos is wonderful, though I have yet to order any prints.  I love the zoom and though I always want a massive zoom (most of my photography is of my dogs) this one is more than adequate for my needs.  This is a vast improvement over my last digital which was 6 years old and very large and unwieldy.  It had a higher zoom but this zoom works much better.  I've wanted a Canon for years and am very impressed with it so far.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Kaitlynn Borruso
Reviews.Content: I'm a vlogger. I make daily video blogs and upload them to YouTube. This camera is great because it shoots in 1080p. It's give my videos a more professional look. It's not this big bulky camera. Fits perfectly in my pocket (even though the directions clearly say not to put in your pocket). Takes great pictures as well. I take a lot of action shots for my sisters soccer games and they come out clear.  All and all I recommend this camera to anyone looking for good quality.

Reviews.Title: product is working out well
Reviews.Author: Chrlens Shields
Reviews.Content: I dont see that there were any problem with it as far as I can tell everything is working out with it just fine

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Seems to be working very well.  I haven't had a chance to use any of the features either but it takes nice pictures and easy videos too.  And its small enough to carry around in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Ingenious Product
Reviews.Author: Mileman "Mileman"
Reviews.Content: What can one say about an ingenious product from a top innovating camera maker company like Canon. It is not nice to go repeat the features of it but now I carry it with me almost in my pocket wherever I go. Clear HD pics and vids, blue tooth connection - even though I haven't used it yet to direct print or transfer data into my computer, an ELPH 1000 stayed with me for years and I expect this one to continue for the years to come

Reviews.Title: Far surpasses my expectations
Reviews.Author: James Hall "VulcanRobot"
Reviews.Content: The slow-mo feature degrades the video quality at 120fps, and severely degrades at 240fps, but it's still useful and fun. On feature I didn't know it had was that ability to shoot a pseudo time lapse at either 5x, 10x or 20x normal video speed. I LOVE this and been using the heck out it. The full auto setting captures everything I've shot, and uses the flash far less than any other camera I've owned. I highly recommend. Just be prepared to use your finger nails to navigate the settings as it's very small, which is also a feature I love!

Reviews.Title: No problem with wifi
Reviews.Author: Stunifoo
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera a few days. I took some photos that seem to be very detailed and the automatic settings work fine. What I can say for sure is that the wifi is pretty simple. Basically, you need to name your camera. After doing that, I loaded the app on my iPad, made sure the wifi was connected, and it did the rest. If you have a security code, you need to only enter it once. Couldn't be easier. You will need to push one button on the camera to turn on wifi, but that's basically it. No more laptops and cords, and the photos are definitely better than iphone quality.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: So far I am absolutely loving this awesome camera. I decided to purchase this particular camera because I wanted to take good videos of my son. I noticed many YouTube vlogers use this camera, I figured it must be great if its a go to for people who make their living using it!!! And I have not been disappointed yet. I think my favorite feature is how on a certain setting it takes mini videoe between pictures. I like looking at these and seeing a quick clip of our entire day.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: pittsburgh50
Reviews.Content: I was trying to get a simple point and shot camera but this camera is very nice with good pictures but way too much in the button and switch different mode.  It was worse than a computer to deal with.

Reviews.Title: Does the job, great value.
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Took it on vacation about a week after I purchased it.  Took nice pictures inside and outside and I enjoyed playing with the different functions.  Had fun with the fish eye but won't use it regularly.  For only $119 feels like a great find!  Easy to use.  What I expected.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: James H. Mansfield
Reviews.Content: Small enough to take with you in your pocket. Excellent image quality. Takes very good 720P movies. 10X zoom works well. Very easy camera to use. Good battery life. Works well indoors with fairly low light for both pictures and movies. Only shortcoming is that the battery door is sort of hard to open and doesn't seem too sturdy. Otherwise, the camera is little short of incredible for the size and price.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Evelyn G. Frolich
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an easy to use camera for a European vacation. This camera has a lot of options for customized picture taking but the basic functions work well in a pinch. The size is compact and light making it more likely to be with us when we see the perfect shot. The zoo lens is wonderful. Overall this camera is a vast improvement over my seven or eight year old model.

Reviews.Title: Good value and quality
Reviews.Author: Inga Mari
Reviews.Content: I would have liked a little more in a camera.  I had a more expensive Canon and thought this would be comparable, but the buttons are very different and not particularly user-friendly.  I would recommend it for the quality of the photos, but I don't like having to read the manual for everything I wish to do.

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: The Canon ELPH series constitutes light-weight, fun cameras, available in many colors, and focused on convenience. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that I think many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the whole picture.The ELPH330 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 12.1 resolution (megapixels), and a x10 zoom. The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CMOStype, which is standard for cameras of its class.It does not have a viewfinder, which, again, many in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 6400, a slight improvement over ELPH 320. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 461,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. The burst rate is a reasonable 2.4 frames persecond- great for quick shots. The weight of the camera is a convenient 155 grams.The main difference between the ELPH series starting 300s is the new Digic 5 processor, and CMOS sensor instead of CCD. The ELPH 110, and 115 had Digic 4.Overall, nice, fun camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Everything we needed in a compact size
Reviews.Author: MARK HAMMEL
Reviews.Content: The 10x Optical zoom is amazing for the size, the battery life is incredible and it even helps a novice like me take good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Trip to the French Riviera couldn't have been captured better!
Reviews.Author: mapgie
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my husband to take some pictures as a fill-in for mine using a higher end camera on a recent trip to the French Riviera. Now that we're back and a book has been made, it's very rare to be able to differentiate which photo came from what camera. This little Canon was exceptional in size, reaction and photo quality. The best thing is it's range and clarity of distance shots! Impressive! It's not as good on low or night shots, but he wasn't aware of the scene changing option either while taking photos, so it may be just fine if used in the right mode.Overall, this is a winner, and the cost was a no brainer. I think I may even consider getting one to replace my much more expensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for low light picture taking
Reviews.Author: Raymond's_musing
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a month now.  I have never had a camera that performs this well on low light.  I can take pictures in a restaurant without using flash and it will still look terrific.  The ISO usually is 1600 but it isn't grainy.  The size is perfect to bring anywhere.  It takes better pictures than any smartphones out there.  At this price, it is also a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330
Reviews.Author: BagLady
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best! Makes great video and takes great pictures. I had the canon vixia but it broke I didn't want to spend another $1000 on a video cam so I thought I would try the Canon PowerShot ELPH 330 12.1MP. Let me tell you this camera is just as good and way easier to burn dvd's and upload to facebook.  I wanted to be able to pop out the card and put it in my computer and make dvd/s from the video.  Buy this camera, its easy as pie and makes great video

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: snipitz
Reviews.Content: The instructions are a little complicated but the camera takes great pictures. I would recommend it for the price, for the casual user you don't need to spend a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: best camera in price range for most users
Reviews.Author: rdnskrs "rdsnkrs"
Reviews.Content: for picture/video quality, features, ease of use, etc this is the best camera in the under $150 price range currently.

Reviews.Title: Pocket friendly.
Reviews.Author: JTD
Reviews.Content: My wife actually picked this camera out for me, she's a pro. I wanted something I could carry around and take pictures to post on Facebook. This little thing is perfect for that purpose.This is my first digital camera, and it takes great pictures, zoomed, regular, or macro.I throw it in my pocket where ever I go and, boom there she is when I want her. Light, portable and, easy to us. Who could ask for anything more?

Reviews.Title: It takes pictures, but buyer beware
Reviews.Author: John Van Walsum "Frequent flyer extrodinaire"
Reviews.Content: The camera took nice pictures, was easy to use, and fit nicely in a pocket.  Electronics being electronics are subject to failure at some point, and I had the misfortune of experiencing a failure after 30 days.  I couldn't exchange it with Amazon any longer, which I expected, so I contacted Canon.  After filling out the forms, mailing the camera to the Canon service center, they notified me that the fault was covered under warranty and they were sending me a replacement, and the replacement was a refurbished like new camera.  I wasn't pleased with this, as refurbished units only come with a 30 day warranty, and now I was loosing nearly 9 months of warranty.  Canon assured me that the replacement would have the original new 1 year warranty.  Lets just say that's the second biggest lie after "The checks in the mail".  60 days later I had the misfortune of anther failure with the replacement camera and my worst fear came to fruition.  When contacting Canon, they were happy (thrilled is a better word) to inform me that the warranty had expired and that I would be responsible for payment.  Chuck this loss up to lessons learned.

Reviews.Title: Lens Defect
Reviews.Author: Leatrice Ann Eng
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since March 2013.  It's been replaced once because the camera lens doesn't shut completely.  Now this replacement is going through the same problem.  I can't have it replaced anymore.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the Canon PowerShot ELPH 330.  It takes much better photos than my Nikon Coolpix especially at night. I would have given it a 5 star except that the video sound did not come out that good when I was recording a live band in a bar.  The sound did seem to work ok when I tested it at home and  was talking into the camera. I would recommend it and would buy it again.I did not buy it for the wifi part and didn't spend time trying to figure that out.  I am mentioning that because that part looked like it was a little confusing.  Someone else who has used that feature before may have no problem with it

Reviews.Title: Clear hi-res video, good sound.
Reviews.Author: Dakota
Reviews.Content: Great vlogging starter camera for its price range. Zoom sound records loudly, only a minor irritation. Sound is good, I've enjoyed this camera so far.

Reviews.Title: A Tiny Powerhouse and a Great Substitute for the Larger DSLR Cameras
Reviews.Author: D. Jefferson
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-professional photographer; and this is the camera I carry with me when I cannot bring my Nikon D5200 DSLR.  The "Program" exposure feature is fantastic in that it automatically sets the shutter and aperture based on the light and the object the camera is exposed for.  The 10x optical zoom is a great feature, too.  I can take wide shots or I can zoom in on my subject. Also, the 12.1 MP allows you to take color rich clear photos in small and larger sizes. The processor is fast, so you can catch those shots of your forever in motion children. They won't be a big blur. No, this camera is not as versatile as my DSLR, but it has a TON of features (bells and whistles), and it is a great substitute when you cannot carry around the larger camera. I have taken some beautiful photographs with my Canon ELPH 330.  Several of these photos were selected for an art gallery exhibit in May 2014.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Lynch
Reviews.Content: I've had two of theses, one took film and my other is digital. We bought this one for our son for Christmas. He'd had one previously too, but it got wet on a fishing trip and hasn't worked well since. These cameras take nice photos and the camera is so small and compact that it is easy to take anywhere. I carry mine in my purse most the time.

Reviews.Title: Pocket size
Reviews.Author: Dave "DRB"
Reviews.Content: Its easy to carry around and takes good point and shoot photos.  The WiFi was hard to set up and doesn't seem necessary.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves it
Reviews.Author: Lady Di 1882
Reviews.Content: My mom dropped her old camera and wanted another one that took the same battery as she had a spare on for back up.. This fit the bill

Reviews.Title: Fun camera, could be better
Reviews.Author: Rainslick
Reviews.Content: Delay when taking images is annoying. Also using the zoom at its greastest distance makes for a very fuzzy image...why even bother? Still I like the camera and when you do get the shot you want the detail and color is great. I suggest keeping it in the video mode and shooting stills this way. Better response time, and it keeps a mini video made up of your photo shoot, very fun.

Reviews.Title: yeah man
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I had this camera awhile back and then I dropped it and I just recently had enough money to get a new one.Canons are my favorite. I also have Canon Powershot SX30 IS which I enjoy very much for making youtube videos and such.This camera has different features and what not on it that is fun to play around with.This camera has great quality for such a small camera, if you are into youtube videos and make your own and want to get into vlogging this is the camera I would recommend to you.Its nice and small and handy when you are out and about and would like to have a camera that isn't a hassle to carry around.yeah, get it.

Reviews.Title: Nice features
Reviews.Author: JG McClung
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife.  It took her a little time to get used to the buttons and features.  I use Canon equipment and love the quality of their pictures.  This little camera takes really nice shots and video as well.  You can set the aspect ratio for 16:9 and make high def movies.  It is a little small and I sometimes have to be careful I don't drop it but it's a very capable little camera even in low light.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera!
Reviews.Author: J. V. Ramirez "JJ"
Reviews.Content: I have kids who are very active, and I own a film SLR. I got this camera as a backup to my SLR. The camera is compact, light, and takes excellent, excellent pictures in low light. Since I am not experienced with indoor film SLR shooting, I usually get blurry photos with the film SLR. The digital Canon PowerShot I bought specifically for this situation and it has done an excellent job. The pictures are well lit with no flash, and that is what I like.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Mistymo
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a great price at costco before Christmas for my daughter to take to paris while studying abroad for this semester. I thought the wifi would be helpful to easily download photos to her iPad, and laptop. We tried installing and as all the reviews stated couldn't get it to work and it was very complicated process. However, since she's been abroad recently she texted me that she easily puts all her photos to phone, iPad and laptop to Dropbox. She said its very cool and easy to do. We have been looking at some beautiful shots of her trip so far.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Very please, this is a very nice camera. A lot of great features. I would recommend it to anybody that would like to have a small easy to carry high-quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bill McCarty
Reviews.Content: Got it for my wife for Christmas easy to use She took many pictures over the holidays and loves it.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures!
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Smith
Reviews.Content: The camera is small and compact, fits in my pocket. The pictures are clear and precise. I also love the zoom.

Reviews.Title: Excellent all-round camera
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera.  I'm especially glad that it is included with a battery charger.  This replaces another older Canon and I like to new features.

Reviews.Title: all around worthwhile purchase
Reviews.Author: Paul Gurda
Reviews.Content: I wanted a pocket camera that would take good pictures without a lot of fuss, and this one has just served me very well on a long road trip.  Its limitations are predictable, given its size, but I'm happy with it.  A neck loop would have been useful, but I can find one myself if I really feel the need for it.  I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for the same thing: lightweight, pocket-size, good photos, as long as they are aware it's so light it's easy to lose track of if you don't dedicate a zipped pocket to it.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous little camera with giant performance
Reviews.Author: Baldfellow
Reviews.Content: Before I got the ELPH 330, I had the ELPH 300 for a couple of years. I can only speak in superlatives for both of these camers.  With the addition of a few more bells and whistles, the 330 is pretty much like the 300, except with double the optical zoom (10x up from 5x),and it's slightly heavier and larger - but only slightly.  With both of these cameras, every picture is perect, and the resolution is superb for a camera this size.  I've had SLR's for years and years, and have now scaled down to cameras that are lighter and easier to tote around, with no more interchangeable lenses - EVER. With the 300 and 330, I've just set it on automatic, and I'm no longer concerned with the f-stop, or the shutter speed, I'm satisfied to let the camera do it for me, because it does it so very well. It handles contrast fantastically, and gives me better exposures, than more "sophisticated" cameras, like my super-zoom Canon Power-Shot SX 30 IS.  I bought the 330 for myself a few months ago, and I loved it so much I then bought it in pink for my grand-daughter. The best example I can give you is sunsets.  We spend time in Florida, and we get sunsets every night over the water. The 300 and 330 both provide flawless color, depth, and contrast performance, and the sunset pictures ALL turn out just beautifully.  So I'm a fan - and this "shirtpocket" camera is such a great performer that I've made it my main camera when we travel.

Reviews.Title: Sleek and easy to use
Reviews.Author: zinseng
Reviews.Content: I shopped for a couple of weeks before deciding on this sleek little Canon. I purchased a Fujifilm first actually, and returned it and then found this. I love the camera, the picture quality is great, it's easy to hook up to my computer for uploading and editing images. The whole package of it is great. I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5 because I recently started running into a small issue of the camera telling me to charge the battery instead of turning on.. even with a fully charged battery. Simple fix, I just pop the battery out and back in, but it's annoying if you're trying to capture something in the moment. My only other issue so far has been the noise from zoom during video content.I'm pleased with my purchase overall and even with the small glitch I'm satisfied overall. I never expect perfection from electronics anymore.The big seller on this camera for me by the way was the speed of initiation. I can turn it on and start snapping like.. within two secs it seems like. It's fast.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: J. Hey "cure searcher"
Reviews.Content: Size you would expect from an ELPHQuality pictureQuality videoOverall GreatThis one will not disappoint, expecially the wallet!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera that I have ever owned.  It takes really clear pictures in all but the lowest light.  The long zoom is also really nice.  It is small and light too.

Reviews.Title: Great Pics love the color
Reviews.Author: AKgirl
Reviews.Content: Takes great pics!!!  Love the color of the camera and it is so small!!! Wonderful zoom and big screen yay

Reviews.Title: I'm back again........
Reviews.Author: Rl Shuey
Reviews.Content: In the past I had bought a couple of the Canon ELPH cameras and loved them, but a few years ago I got a wild hair and bought a SLR to replace the my last ELPH. Since then I grew to dislike the SLR and miss my old ELPH. Why? Because I found that I was missing a lot of shots, because: the SLR and all the accessories was too big to lug around, I had to guard it all the time due money I had wrapped in the whole SLR kit, I missed a lot of fun (because I became the family photographer, "cause I had the fancy camera"), I was mostly taking photos in auto (because I was mostly taking photos of my grandkids and didn't have time to use manual controls) and I could go on and on. Well I solved my problem, because I got rid of my SLR and got me another ELPH. Now I'm back to having fun taking photos and due to the advancement in the ELPH's I'm getting 95% of what I was getting with my SLR so thats good enough for me. I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: Perfect point and shoot
Reviews.Author: David Murray
Reviews.Content: Perfect point and shoot camera. I was looking for a camera that offers consistancy and simplicity and that is what I found in this camera. If you are looking for something that does not require much manual setting and still delivers very good pictures (and great video quality, too), thne look no further. This camera is simple and takes great pictures. For the more advanced photographer, there is the option to have manual settings and tweak things a bit.

Reviews.Title: affordable and beautiful photos
Reviews.Author: Mark L
Reviews.Content: excellent gift idea. the perfect combination for an affordable, easy to use camera and it takes beautiful photos.  my daughter loves it

Reviews.Title: My take on the ELPH 330 camera
Reviews.Author: M. White "Whitestix"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a replacement for an SD880 IS, which was a few years old.  It gave me great photos in a small camera, but the flash crapped out.  The 330 is a fine little camera and takes great photos.  I especially like the extended zoom lens.  And it is so compact that you can carry it in your pocket.  At its price point, this is a very nice camera.  Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: SUCH A GREAT LITTLE CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: summer
Reviews.Content: I boughtCanon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS before this.. It held up for 3 years until someone dropped it. I quickly bought this knowing I would have no problems. The resolution is amazing, the features are fun, and it fits in my pocket. I LOVE LOVE LOVE this camera.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good little camara
Reviews.Author: Vickie Ortega
Reviews.Content: The only thing I don't like about this camara is that you have to through the menu to turn on the timer. It's a little strange that the timer is so many clicks away, but I'm getting used to it. Everything can't be at your finger tips. ... One tip for everyone, this camara seems to work better without the flash. So if a picture is a little dark or grainy, try it again without the flash.

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Lange
Reviews.Content: Excellent little camera!  Pictures were clear and sharp and the camera is light and easy to use.  For the price this camera is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: Shari
Reviews.Content: By stepping up slightly in price of camera , we got a great camera for the price.  Lots of features.  Very easy to use.  Great pictures.  I love rechargeable battery.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Zoom
Reviews.Author: Emilye
Reviews.Content: Awesome zoom!  Took it on my cruise and got all the shots I wanted to get.  Love Canon and am very happy with this little point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Layne T. Oliver
Reviews.Content: I love this little gem of a camera, it is very easy to use  and is ultra compact and produces beautiful pictures

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Use the Smile Capture Feature
Reviews.Author: F. Brown
Reviews.Content: You have to hand it to some of these camera manufactures.  There's a feature on this camera call smile capture and it really works.  Used the feature during our Son's wedding.  Set the smile capture and it takes photos by itself whenever someone in the viewfinder smiles.  Incredible!

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: harrisrb
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace a Canon elph 310 that was broken.I love the low light photo quality and I use the video feature allot.The 330 seems to have better audio quality than the 310.( Which was my only complaint with the 310)Love the photo and video quality and the pocket size. Easy to take with you everywhere.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Joan S Hart
Reviews.Content: I have been enoying this camera, it fits into pants pockets, so makes it great for hiking. The camera is ready at a moments notice for taking wildlife photos.  The motion stablizing means pics are not bleary.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely great camera
Reviews.Author: J. M. Hillyard
Reviews.Content: This camera has all of the features one could possibly use on a camera of this type and especially for the money. Easy to learn and use. Great software, I love that it records the camera settings at the time of the picture. Makes it easier to become a good photographer.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: M. Howie
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about the color since this was a gif but she loved it and it works wonderfully. Great zoom and great speed!

Reviews.Title: Excellent little camera with a lot of features.
Reviews.Author: Mark McMickle
Reviews.Content: Very good point and shoot.  The only downside is that the WiFi features are difficult to setup and use.  Still, probably the best value for the money out there in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Compact and amazing zoom
Reviews.Author: Anna Karolina Mayer
Reviews.Content: Got this camera because of the compact size. It was even smaller tan expected.I used it all along an Alaska travel and photos have a great quality, bright true colors and zoom 10X was very usefull to capture wildlife.  Absolutel recommend it if you're looking for a light weight/ compact camera

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: ZS "Pathology"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.Great pictures.We tried Wi-Fi, it works!I think this camera is good even for more sir serious work.

Reviews.Title: Love my pink camera!
Reviews.Author: Alaine
Reviews.Content: I have always had Canon cameras and this one certainly has not disappointed thus far! Picture quality is amazing and so is the zoom! Very happy with my purchase and the color is definitely fun!

Reviews.Title: disappointing useless macro
Reviews.Author: whatIthink
Reviews.Content: this is my 4th ELPH. I keep upgrading. this has an amazing zoom. however, I recently used the macro, the lens is so long, it blocks the flash, so I kept getting dark photos, with half shadows on my objects. since I bought this to take close up photos of small items for my work, its pretty useless. I even took the camera outside, to use in full sunlight. it just doesn't take a good close up like the last 3 did. not happy with this one. its going to get shelved and I will look for a better one. this is what I get for buying a similar camera based on past experience. I loved my ELPH 300HS-till I dropped it and cracked the screen. I should have just replaced that one.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality very good, but wireless performance stinks
Reviews.Author: WPM
Reviews.Content: I bought this to have a good quality camera that could fit in my pocket for when I don't want to haul around my SLR (which is a lot of the time.) Picture quality is very good, although facial tones need some tweaking, particularly in low light. The size is great and the camera (I have a black one) is very sharp looking. I wish it had an aperture or shutter speed setting, but that is a common missing feature on small cameras. Why do camera companies think only novices use these?Wireless on this camera is a failure. The instructions to set it up are comically vague. How anyone could sign off on these as complete, is beyond me. You have to download an app for your phone, then link the camera to the phone to download to your phone from where you can send via email or link to a website. It took me about 45 minutes of agonizing to figure it out, but I finally got it set up and working.  However, a few weeks later when I tried to use it while actually taking pictures, the camera and phone wouldn't connect. I've since tried everything to get them connecting, to no avail. It wasn't a key feature for me in purchasing this camera, but I would use it occasionally if it worked, so it's frustrating. That's why I knocked a star off my rating.

Reviews.Title: Lacks flexibility. Too many cutsie bells and whistles.
Reviews.Author: Peter Meyer
Reviews.Content: In other than straightforward shots, the choices as compared to a 2010 Lumix DMCFH20K (less money too) are woefully inadequate and "artsy". Also, the menu format is less intuitive.

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Alison R.
Reviews.Content: I was in the market for a point and shoot camera.After reading many reviews I decided that this was the camera for me.I took it on my cruise this summer and to Scotland and Paris and this camera did a WONDERFUL job.Great for quick pictures, auto-adjusts to different settings which was perfect from going from museums to outdoor attractions.Great battery life.Wonderful quality pictures, clear and bright..so wonderful.Cannot rave more about this camera. If your in the market for something simple and effective this is your camera!Haven't tried the wifi yet, but will update when the time is right.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: dana courtad
Reviews.Content: This camera is very user friendly. It's fits easily in your back pocket. It takes very quick shots and pictures come out very clear. I've had a couple different canon cameras but I think this is my favorite. It's battery life is excellent. I would recommend this product to anyone that enjoys taking simple everyday pictures.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Winston-Salem
Reviews.Content: I gave this as a gift. But I do know from the user that it was a great and never got put down once during the whole day. She was very happy to get this as a birthday present.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but the wireless connection is slow.
Reviews.Author: Admindude
Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically to transfer video and I discovered that it is way to slow to be practical. Other than that it seemed to be a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Is This Better Than My iPhone?  Maybe
Reviews.Author: Ph0t0z "disknecht"
Reviews.Content: I'm a DSLR shooter who just needed something to take shots better than my iPhone, has zoom capability, that I can shove in a pocket and is quick and easy to use.  I'm struggling to rate this camera objectively because I am a DSLR user and used to full rich photos, but then again this was a $170 camera, so I need to be a lot less picky!  I'm still testing it out, but here are first impressions:1.  Easy to use right out of the box, you can start taking pics without struggling with the user guide.  Put in the battery and off you go.2.  Menu systems are easy, but I'm a Canon DSLR peep so no struggle for me.3.  Buttons are all placed easily, you can switch to a video shot by pushing the BIG RED button, so you can't miss that.  I will say the flat button is sort of a pain, a raised 4 quadrant button would be so much easier, but this is very doable once you get used to the feel of it.4.  Zooming is easy, not too noisy on the video side, typical of a point and shoot.  For me the 10x isn't really enough, and picture quality on the full zoom in a darkened or shadowy area is not great.  Again I'm picky, I can't help it.  I think for me this is where the camera fails a bit, but other cameras I tried failed at this as well in this price category.5.  Video - pretty darn good, I was surprised.  It was catching birds chirping and very crisp video.  Color is not all the way there, but it is good, no question.6.  Low light without flash - you know what, surprisingly good compared to a Nikon in the same class of camera.  I had taken back a Nikon as it failed in low light for me.7. Wireless - I don't think it was that hard to figure out at all, I'm not sure why all these other folks are complaining.  Just read the directions!  I took a shot, downloaded the Canon ap, used the camera as a wireless access and point and "boom" had access to all the photos on the camera right on my phone.  It's clunky, but isn't all new technology?  If you want to take a pic and send it immediately that's what your iPhone is for. Honestly just go home and download to your pc.  I'm not complaining on this point, if I'm in the middle of nowhere and can send via my phone and upload to Facebook from there, well then that's a home run for me.8.  Screen - bright, easy to see, pics look pretty true.9.  Battery - seems to be fine, taking video, playing with the wireless, taking shots and hasn't budged off the full battery.10.  Photo color - eh, ok.  For the normal user who keeps it on Auto and just wants to take photos of the kids, group shots, etc I think you will be fine.11.  Other features - I haven not gotten into everything as yet.  I'll add more as I play around with it.Overall you can't beat a Canon.  I really struggled as to which camera to buy and read so many reviews to figure out what was best.  You will take decent shots most of the time and video is super easy and looks good.  I'm giving it a 4 star for now which is kind of pushing it for me, but I think in this class of point and shoot in this price category you can't do much better.  I think this is still a bit better than your iPhone due to zooming capability especially for video.  It's a grab and go and get decent shots and it's super small and fits easily into a pocket to go anywhere.  Not sure the Powershots a class up from this can truly claim that.  This is smaller than my iPhone so it easily fits in my back pocket with no issues.

Reviews.Title: The HD quality
Reviews.Author: Neil
Reviews.Content: This takes the best pictures I've ever saw from such a small light weight camera. I love every aspect of ELPH 330 from the level of zoom to the Wi/Fi. I love it and I completely recommend it

Reviews.Title: Wifi doesn't work with Windows 7 Home Basic
Reviews.Author: jimbo92107
Reviews.Content: If your lappie is more than a year old, you may find that your shiny new Elph 330HS just can't seem to connect with your computer to transfer stuff to your PC.Another commenter finally located the problem on page 118 of the pdf manual. Page 54 of the paper one."Windows 7 Starter and Home Basic editions are not supported." - p118, Camera User GuideReally. First they've screwed 80 percent of PC users out of the sweetest tech candy on their camera. Second, they tuck the disclaimer so deep in the manual, almost nobody will find it, and not before they buy the thing.That's dishonest. Bad Canon, bad! I spank you with the newspaper of opprobrium!BTW fellow Americans, don't bother downloading Microsoft's "Media Feature Pack for Windows 7 N" from the link for the European Windows.
