Not compatible.Before stumbling upon the pertinent review, I tried connecting wifi directly to three separate lappies, an Asus, an HP, and an Acer. All Windows 7 Basic, but otherwise quite functional computers. All failed to connect.Normally I would return this design-hobbled crap immediately. Unfortunately, it was a gift, and I don't have time for this before my next vacation, so I'll use it for awhile. Also, while it did not connect to my other computers, it did connect and work with my iPad 3, tho I had to add a couple Canon apps.So, the wifi works with iPads, iPhones, maybe Macs, but fails miserably with PC's unless maybe you have a new Windows 8 machine. Not about to upgrade Windows 7 to professional, not for this toy. Mostly I'll just use the USB cable, or pop the card out. WiFi is overrated.Aside from that, the 330HS appears to be a pretty good pocket camera. It's small, very light, turns on very quickly, and in Auto mode takes good, but not great photos. The automatic face recognition sometimes focuses on the wrong object in the frame, but I don't care. 10x optical zoom is sufficient, and I don't bother with digital zoom. Battery life is okay, but to be safe you should buy a couple extras.

Reviews.Title: terrible wifi
Reviews.Author: J. Gary Vallely
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the wifi and found it impossible to set up - instructions are terrible, the interface is not intuitive to say the least and calls to canon tech support were fruitless - would not recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Focus is horrible! Also always says "charge the battery" even after a fresh charge.
Reviews.Author: D. D. Martinez
Reviews.Content: I've owned Powershots since the first S100 came out over a decade ago.  This one, purported to be their best when I bought it this past Summer, is horrible.  At least 80 percent of the pics I take with this are out of focus.  Have tried changing all the settings possible, and have looked at the Canon support site.  No new bios/firmware is available and nothing can prevent this from focusing on the background.Also there must be some problem with the power management on this.  With a brand new lithium ion battery, charged overnight, plugged into the unit, if you turn off the unit and turn it back on 20 minutes later it will say "charge the battery" when the battery is fully charged.  Removing the battery for 30 seconds from the unit and putting it back in seems to get it to re-check the battery but by then I always lose my shot.  I'm returning this.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330 12MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Image
Reviews.Author: Amazonian Shopper
Reviews.Content: The camera takes decent pictures.  The only downside is that I can't force the camera to use flash.  It only gives you the option to turn off the automatic flash and the automatic flash isn't reliable.  The flash goes off when the camera feels conditions are suitable for flash usage.I haven't used all the features the camera has to off yet such as its Wi-Fi capabilities but I hear that can be problematic as well.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I've had many Powershots over the years. The Powershot 330 is exactly like all the other models.  Easy to use.  All the same features. It does though seem to take better pictures in low or dark light.  Which is very impressive to me because it's something I'm always looking for.

Reviews.Title: meh
Reviews.Author: David Rahmlow
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a recent vacation.  I'm used to using a DSLR, so perhaps my standards are high, but I wasn't particularly impressed.Battery life was not very good - it typically ran out of charge halfway through the day.  A friend with a similar Canon camera noted that the battery has only half the mAh rating (at the same voltage) as the one he got with his camera...even though the battery is almost the same physical size.Auto mode was frustrating - it tended to crank up exposure time before changing ISO.  This invariably resulted in blurry photos under anything except the best lighting conditions.When taking close-up shots, it was nearly impossible to get the camera to focus on the desired object.  Even if you turn the macro setting on, it really wanted to focus on things in the background.  And AFAIK, this model doesn't allow manual focus.I haven't tried to get wi-fi working.  I'm not really sure what the "use case" is for this feature, rather than just transferring the memory card to a card reader on the computer.The menu system makes it somewhat slow to change settings (ISO, exposure compensation, etc).  I tended to leave it at ISO 800.  The picture is a bit noisy if you zoom in, but not too bad.  The processing it does leaves behind a somewhat odd pattern of digital artifacts in the image.Zoom is ok, but at high zoom levels you are clearly not going to be making anywhere near full use of the sensor resolution.Still, it is small and image quality is usually ok - and that was the main criteria.

Reviews.Title: Photos from vacation to France - BEAUTIFUL!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Chauvin
Reviews.Content: Small enough to fit in pocket or purse, clear crisp photos. Just what we were looking for! Definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice point-and-shoot with clunky but useful wi-fi
Reviews.Author: A. Benenson
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small camera that takes good quality photos. The wi-fi feature is handy, but it can a bit of a hassle to set up, and a bit of a pain to use, but it works (I've included a lot more about the wi-fi further down in this review).As far as the physical design, the only thing I don't like the buttons on the back are all small, and flat and flush, making it sometimes difficult to tell if your finger is in the right place. It's also not great that the battery/memory door is plastic, but it seems fairly sturdy.Regarding picture taking features, most of the the expected bells and whistles are there - lots of scene modes, face recognition, etc. The only one that's missing is sweep panorama capability; instead there's a "stitch assist" mode that requires you to merge photos together later using software on your computer.The rest of this review will focus on the wi-fi since it's a relatively new thing on cameras and I was curious to try it out....If you want to have the camera use wi-fi to send photos to Google Drive, Flickr, Twitter, etc. or Canon's own similar photo-sharing service, you first need to visit Canon's website to download software for your Mac or PC to register the camera and set up which services you'll want it to access. The process works but it's a bit confusing and some steps seem redundant.However, you can skip all of that if you just want the camera to wirelessly connect to your PC, smartphone, another camera, or a wi-fi printer.To start wi-fi whenever you want to transfer some photos, put the camera in playback mode, hit the "up" button and you'll get a menu showing the devices you can connect to (and any services you had set up, see above). Pick one, and the camera will then let you choose wi-fi network to connect to.If it's a new network that requires a password, the camera will display a tiny on-screen keyboard that lets you peck out the password using the direction and OK buttons.Once you're connected, the camera will let you select photos to upload. You can send the current photo, or select up to 50 photos - one at a time (there's no way to select multiple photos in one step). You also can choose whether to send them at original size or resize them smaller (two choices), which will speed up the transfer.The transfer seems reasonably fast and once it's done the camera automatically disconnects from the wi-fi.If you want to transfer photos to your smartphone or tablet instead of an online service, then it's mostly the same process; before you start you need to have installed Canon's Camera Window app on your phone/tablet, and have it open.Once the camera is connected to your phone/tablet, you go through the same steps described above on the camera to transfer the photos to your device. The Camera Window app displays each photo as it's downloaded, and it copies them to your device's regular photos/gallery app.The Camera Window app is very basic; it doesn't let you zoom the photos, and it doesn't provide any way to preview and select photos on the camera (that has to be done on the camera as explained above). There's also no way to remotely control the camera to use it as a sort of wireless webcam for instance.Overall I found the wi-fi features to be reliable and functional, if a bit limited. There are some other wi-fi features I haven't used yet, such as printing or transferring to another camera.That's it for the review. I like the camera, but obviously I'm not happy that it's needing warranty service after less than a month of use!...UPDATE:Unfortunately after using this camera for about a week (on vacation, so frequent use), it began unpredictably showing "Charge the battery" errors and refusing to power on, even when the battery was mostly or fully charged.I sent it back to Canon for warranty repair (it was a fairly painless process), and they sent me back a replacement camera and battery in a couple of weeks, without a fuss. And even though I had only sent them the camera and battery, they sent me back not just those, but another charger too! Not a bad deal at all.The replacement camera and battery have been working fine, even after several weeks of intense use.

Reviews.Title: One of the best Elph models in the Canon line-up
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Eastline "ChicagoWriter"
Reviews.Content: The Elph 330 continues the worthy line of compact, full-featured cameras by Canon. Aside from its size---even smaller than its predecessors---it boasts a 10x optical zoom as well as a competitive 12 megapixel spec. The image rendering is very good, offering rich coloration without any sense of exaggeration. Controls are well marked and follow the scheme used in prior models. The Canon approach to setting lesser-used features, such as ISO, is needlessly complicated and often frustrating, however. Canon released two versions of this camera and the preferred model is the 330HS which has HD wi-fi capability, thereby allowing immediate transfer of photos or movie clips to Android and iOS cell phones. The 330IS lacks this feature and is priced only slightly lower. Another plus for the 330 is the minimal shutter lag allowing burst shooting at two frames per second. Both fully automatic and semi-manual modes are available to handle the settings. The sensor is a CMOS and the viewing screen measures 3" with a 460K dot resolution. As for physical disappointments, the cover for the HDMI and USB connectors may not be fragile but it's not up to par with the camera's general workmanship. I'm also unhappy with the deletion of an optical viewfinder, a feature that made the Elph series so impressive. But, on the whole, it's definitely a very impressive contender for a high-quality pocket camera at a highly favorable price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price! Super happy with it.
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon Rebel Xs, a dslr, so I very often compare shutter speed of compact cameras to my dslr, and this camera's shutter speed is pretty good! It takes pictures quickly, and though it could save the picture a little faster, it saves a lot quicker than the cheaper Canon PowerShot cameras. The low light works pretty well and it survived a couple of hours in freezing weather outdoors. When I recorded a video of a performance from the backrow of the performance, I was very happy with the video quality. It managed to refocus every second on the performer's face and I heard him crystal clear, all the way from the back row. The photo quality is great and I have no problem with the battery. It's super small and light. I just wish I didnt need the CD to set up my wifi on the camera because I have an ultra book and I can't set up my wifi without the CD! I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone looking for a great point and shoot!!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, terrible battery life
Reviews.Author: maria2601
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I got a dud of a camera or a dud of a battery but, despite charging the battery to completion, it does not last long.  Even if I recharge the battery and put it back in the camera and not use it for a long time, when I do get around to wanting to use the camera, it won't turn on or it the lens cover only opens halfway or I get a message on the screen that the battery needs changing.This isn't a good feature if I want to keep the camera handy and ready to use at a moment's notice.  It takes playing around with the on/off button for about 5 mins to get the camera to turn on completely.The most annoying thing is that the display says that the battery is fully charged when I do finally manage to turn it on completely, but during the 5 mins of fussing with the camera I get the message that the battery needs charging. What's really going on?I'm not sure what the problem could be.  I keep it safely tucked away in a camera case and and try not to bang it around too much.

Reviews.Title: A well positioned camera...
Reviews.Author: The Wizard "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Recently, I decided to go shopping for a mid-price, all-around point-and-shoot camera. While I expected to do a bit of work to find the best camera for me, I was very surprised at how difficult the task really was. I had a list of musts and nice-to-haves, but was constantly whip-sawed by the sheer volume of information available on so many cameras. Hundreds of cameras, confusing similar products by the same manufacturer, conflicting reviews, and techno-jargon made my search a daunting challenge. Moreover, the countless reviews by experts tend to use the SLR type camera as a gold standard, so anything less is sub-par in their minds. So, if you look at 5 star cameras, they will generally be large, flexible, and very expensive. By the time you work down the list, point-and-shoot cameras designed for the amateur blend into a huge list of less than stellar, 2 and 3 star reviews. However, I did arrive at a decision and purchased this camera.This camera attempts to provide lots of features wrapped up in a very small package. The important items on my list were low light capability and fast recovery, both strong points for this camera. The rest was icing on the cake.Positives for this camera include very good low light shooting, a nice big LCD, very fast recovery between shots, a great zoom, spectacular macro capability, and small size. It is also well priced, as I was willing to spend more, but the combination of features didn't match other cameras at higher prices.As for the negatives, there are three. The wi-fi feature simply does not work for my Windows 7 PC. Canon technical support simply threw their hands up and said there was nothing more they could do. If so, why does my Xbox 360 have no problem connecting to my wireless modem? It didn't really matter, as I could not find a comparable camera without the wi-fi, so it was just a matter of feeling ripped off for a feature that didn't work. Second, the cover to access the USB and HDMI connections is really irritating, because it is difficult to keep out of the way when making connections, compounded by this same location being used to attach the wrist strap. And last, the "hybrid" mode takes a brief video with each picture, supposedly to give you a record of the day's shooting. It has its own switch on the camera back, which was on when I received the camera. At first, I was confused about the wait time for each shot, with a "busy" icon displaying for several seconds, but discovered the switch and turned it off. I feel that it is simply a geegaw, and doesn't deserve the importance attached to very valuable space on the camera.The bottom line: After using this camera for a few weeks, I am pleased with the performance. It is the right camera for me.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I have ever used.
Reviews.Author: Idaho
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I am 61 years old and have used many cameras throughout the years.  This one is easily the best camera I have ever used.  I love the larger than standard optical zoom and the additional digital zoom allows me to capture any picture I want.  It has more than enough preset adjustments.  The super fast shutter speed can capture the wings of a hummingbird in flight.With all that said, I saved the best for last:  This camera takes such great pictures, that it captures small details that are blurred or invisible with most cameras.  I used it to take pictures of the printed circuit board inside my old 36" Sony TV and could zoom in far enough to read the writing on individual components (using the large display on the back of the camera).  I didn't even have to download the pictures to my computer to see the details.I would (and do) recommend this camera to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: seamonkey10
Reviews.Content: Although I am knowledgeable of all the functions of an SLR camera, sometimes I just want to use a camera that is quick and easy to use, and this one fits the bill.  The auto functions on this camera are great, especially when you just want to whip out your camera and take a few quick shots.I've been taking a lot of shots for a website recently, and this camera has come in handy.  It's slim, so it easily fits in a pocket, and it easy to take out and use.  Almost all of the pictures come out great, even if I'm moving or shaking the camera.  Even low light pictures turn out nice.For me the best part of the camera is the 10x zoom lens.  This feature, for me, is one of the best parts of this camera since I often need (or want) to take pictures of something in the distance, and this lens adds a powerful functionality to the camera.I was intrigued by the Wi-Fi capability, but have not used it yet, preferring the quickness of using a card reader instead.One other note: I have to say that this camera is somewhat durable.  On one of my first days using it, the wrist strap got snagged on something when I took it out, causing it to pull out of my hand and tumble to the concrete below.  I cringed knowing that the lens was extended, but to my relief, the camera still works!If you're looking for a powerful camera and do not want to think about functions too much, then this could be the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: I'm happy with it
Reviews.Author: Christopher P Brewer
Reviews.Content: I'm a casual photographer and don't require a high-end camera and I consider this to be an excellent point-and-shoot camera for my purposes. It has all the features I was looking for as well as the ability to download images wirelessly (which I don't really need, but it's nice to have just in case).

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my girlfriend who was going to be studying abroad for the semester. She used it to take all of her pictures and loves it! The protection plan is cheap and worth while as well. Canon is trustworthy and i definitely recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Dhanushka Kularatne
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my wife. She wanted something that takes good pics without knowing too much about photography while fitting comfortably in your pant pocket. This fits the bill perfectly. We have had this for about a month at the time of this review and so far it has been perfect. I am no expert in photography, but the pictures in auto mode come out very crisp and the colors are vivid. The 10x zoom is great, but you need a very steady hand or the pictures come out a little blurry.I would recommend this to anyone who is on the lookout for a small camera that dishes out quality pics.

Reviews.Title: Excellent photos in auto mode but overall poor functionality
Reviews.Author: DCDave
Reviews.Content: I think the auto setting is one of the best I have ever used--turns out consistently good shots in all types of conditions and much better, in many instances, than the presets.  The function button that allows you to take photos and the camera records a short amount of video before the photo is taken is just plain silly.The controls take a good deal of care when operating--even for someone with small fingers.  There are not enough scene selections to choose from--for example, no "Landscape" mode. And, to get to the various scenes you have to actually go into "Program" mode, and the various scenes are mixed in with a bunch of creative effect choices, like "sepia" that aren't the typical scene selections. The Program mode should be accessible via separate control button and Canon's choice not to go this route is plain stupid.The quality of the pictures is excellent, however. The zoom actually can go to 40x and, even when getting into the digital portion of the zoom, pictures come out clear. We took a picture of a coyote about 30 yards away in low evening light and were amazed at how clearly and well exposed the picture was. Have owned a Canon SD1400 and this takes photos with more sharpness. It just isn't as versatile as i had hope mainly due to how Canon decided to incorporate the Program mode and the scene mode and the creative effects modes. It is not very functional if you plan to use those things alot. However, as mentioned, the auto mode is truly excellent on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the price, lots of features
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised upon opening this packaged camera.  It is light and easy to handle.  I haven't used it yet as it just arrived so I am anxious to get started taking pictures.  The reviews were favorable on this model, hence my purchase and I love the color!  I am certainly looking forward to using it.

Reviews.Title: Camera has A lot of issues
Reviews.Author: A Smith
Reviews.Content: Don't recommend. Many issues with this camera (check online re battery issue and you'll see) and Canon has TERRIBLE customer service.  I was on hold for 30 minutes, then transferred around, sent a refurbished camera without my permission, they kept my new one.  The list goes on.

Reviews.Title: Small camera packs a big outcome
Reviews.Author: Dasher
Reviews.Content: Super-easy to use; sharp, clear photos that enlarge and print beautifully; so easy ot travel with. I have a Canon T3i with three lenses, but didn't want to a) endanger my old camera and lenses traveling to and through France, and b) I wanted something easy to carry as we did a lot of walking.This camera was the perfect choice. I still haven't figured out the wi-fi connection, but that's on me.

Reviews.Title: Decent battery, FAST startup, small and solid
Reviews.Author: Dave "Dave"
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this camera is that it takes only about 1 second to start up. Turn it on, ready to shoot in 1 second... This is MUCH faster than most point and shoot cameras under $300-- I know because I looked for a long time before buying this one.One thing to remember-- you can turn off the start screen through the menu--this lets you get that quick start up and ready to shoot time.Otherwise--small camera, smaller than an iphone or Galaxy--but about twice as thick. Still pretty good for having an REAL 10x zoom--optical, not crummy digital zoom.pictures write to the card pretty quick. If you're experienced with cameras, no need to bother installing the Canon software. Just put the memory card in your reader/computer and download that way.There is a newer version of this camera, which means sometimes prices aren't that great for this one.Body feels like aluminum but not sure. Definitely gets cold like metal when it is cold out.Only con I can think of is putting your finger near the flash, but not covering it, you can sometimes block some of the light.

Reviews.Title: does NOT come with battery
Reviews.Author: happydot
Reviews.Content: was ready to use it right away but couldn't because it doesn't come with a battery. so was disappointed at first.also don't know what the problem is sometimes and says it jams sometimes so have to turn it off. cannot think of exactly what it says, but i have to wait and turn it off and then on again.i bought its predecessor in tokyo, japan and i was sad i didn't buy this version there. i know it would've come with the battery included!

Reviews.Title: Not able to send pictures from this camera
Reviews.Author: Miha Todd
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my teen daughter.Pros: it is small, takes good pictures, nice color choicesCons: cannot figure out how to send pictures … have other cameras that are more user-friendly

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: jehousto
Reviews.Content: Camera fits in my pocket, has 10X zoom with image stablization, and takes really good pictures even in low light.  You can buy better camera but they won't fit in your pocket like this one.  I'm much more likely to have this camera with me because of the size.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, still testing
Reviews.Author: Andrea Dreskin
Reviews.Content: Got this camera based on research and many good reviews.  Very light compared to my last Canon point and shoot and also very small.  I wish it had more metal parts and was slightly bigger.  It is a great low light camera, but did not do so well in the shade or bright sun.  The program mode is useless and there is not much you can do to customize your settings if auto is not doing a good job.  Still do not like it as much as my last camera, but maybe I just need more time with it.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!
Reviews.Author: Mandy Choens
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an older elph and I was VERY disappointed. The photos were not as clear and much darker than the older elph. It really angered me that I wasted $35 for restocking and shipping to return this junk product. I am an avid Canon fan and have two other Canons but this one wasn't even worth keeping.

Reviews.Title: Girlfriend LOVES this camera
Reviews.Author: Isaiah Thomas
Reviews.Content: I researched for about a week or so on which camera to buy my girlfriend for her bday. Most of the results brought me to this being the best point & shoot camera under $200.My girlfriend has over 1000 photos on her Iphone and loves taking pictures. Since I bought her this camera three weeks ago, SHE HAS NOT PUT IT DOWN! The pictures come out amazing, the zoom works really well, and the videos are flawless! I would reccomend this camera to anyone who wants great, clear pictures and isn't aiming to be an actual photographer.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera.
Reviews.Author: Lily Serene "Lily"
Reviews.Content: Nothing to rave about, but nothing to complain about either.  It's easy to cary around and works well enough.  I really wanted something a little faster, and with the ability to easily choose to force the light on (meaning in one step) but couldn't find that. I'd still like to know if there's something better in this class, but I won't complain about it.  Pictures are good.

Reviews.Title: Only Cannon for me
Reviews.Author: Janet Amaral
Reviews.Content: After over 45 years of taking pictures, I dropped and broke my camera.  I had a Cannon so I replaced it with a new Cannon model.  This camera does everything.  I take this point and shoot on all my trips and the pictures I take come out beautiful.  I also love the pink because I can see it in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Great for the sprice. Good photos.
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I liked my older PowerShot ELPH a little better, but in all honesty it's basically the same exact camera. If I wasn't so used to my older one I'd give this 5 stars. It just took a but of getting used to some of the changes.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camer
Reviews.Author: steve swinger
Reviews.Content: i like everything about it.  I have owned it for a few years now without any problems.  It is light and compact.

Reviews.Title: Sent back for repair after 4 months!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Plemmons
Reviews.Content: Camera is nice but after 4 months the shutter will not open!  Have to call Canon get "all" the info to send back, drive to UPS this is the problem when dealing with third party on amazon!! No camera for how long???

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Beth Gray-Robertson
Reviews.Content: Although there is a newer model, I purchased this because the batteries are the same as in the camera I was replacing. The 330 is absolutely awesome!!! It performs extremely well in low lighting for still shots. I love, love, love the zoom AND how it has a mode to create a video before each still shot. The continuous shoot feature is better than I imagined!! What's not to love about this point-and-shoot camera!!

Reviews.Title: Wife's Xmas present turned out to be great!
Reviews.Author: Biomedman
Reviews.Content: 5 months later and this little Elph works great! We stuck it in a small waterproof camera bag and took it to the beaches and on a waterfall hike (literally hiking all the way up the falls in the water) and all of the pictures came out great! Very portable and the batteries last a very long time. Programmable to an extent with a nice feature set. I/we are very happy with the camera! BTW, I own several Canon cameras (EOS w/L-lenses, G15, etc. so I am very experienced with Canon and photography in general)

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures but the WiFi is a bear to connect to
Reviews.Author: Spokaneman
Reviews.Content: The camera works well and is a nice compact size.  It has a decent telephoto and other scene and mode settings.  Trying to connect the camera to my wireless router was pretty much impossible as trying to enter the alphanumericspecialcharacter  password using the camera's tiny buttons was basically impossible with my arthritic hands and limited attention span. I wish there was a way you could connect it to a computer to enter the password.  For now I have just given up on the WiFi.  When one of my kids are in town, I will get them to do it.

Reviews.Title: Marvelous Camera
Reviews.Author: SLO Life "SLO Life"
Reviews.Content: We love this one! We still don't know all the great stuff it can do, but what we've tried out has been great. Takes sharp photos, gives you several ways to download to your computer for editing (and you can also edit in the camera). Small but I can access all the buttons, etc., even with fairly large hands. Lightweight and fits in a pocket. All around a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Neil Benson "neilbco"
Reviews.Content: I purchased an early version of this model in 2007. The newer version is smaller, and has more options to enhance your ability to take a good picture. the colors are much more vivid. Best of all I can take HDMI movies of my granddaughter. Unfortunately, as usual, manual that comes with the camera is best read with a magnifying glass. I have yet to take advantage of the Wi-Fi capabilities. Ignore any ratings of one star or two star.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Lorna J. Benedict
Reviews.Content: Difficult to get the pictures off and the videos as well. They download into Adobe which is not the best place.Camera is easy to use and light weight .Nice for the grandkids to take pictures with. I enjoy it too but zoom is a bit to fast and causes you to take too much time getting closeup shots - especially when you are taking pictures of little kids who don't stay still long.

Reviews.Title: Stopped Working in Less Than 4 Months
Reviews.Author: D. Laster
Reviews.Content: Received this cameria on January 7, 2014.. Used a couple times and it sat on the side of my desk. Now the camera won't take a charge and won't turn on. PORTABLE GUY says no refund after 30 days. Don't by this.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Ofelia Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: Great camera and simple to use , way better than my iPhone 4S for pictures and videos inside and outside.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: WILLIAM A GENT
Reviews.Content: Great camera for my wife which she found to be easy to use. Usual anon quality, she will enjoy on our trip.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: Larry N. Armentrout "lnausa"
Reviews.Content: I fell and dropped my Canon SX280HS canon, which had never worked well in bright light. It was my third one and I had it only 3 months. Because a friend had an ENPH and it took such great shots, I gave it a try this time. It has everything the other one had but the increased zoom lens. Both have email capacity but I never use it.  It takes great pics and is smaller and cheaper!

Reviews.Title: Great replacement for my last ELPH
Reviews.Author: AFV
Reviews.Content: My last ELPH Powershot died after having been dropped, frozen, drenched, and overheated about 30 times.  After my positive experience with and ELPH camera, I decided to give it another go.Improvements over my old camera:Opens and is ready to take a picture fasterSeemingly better video qualityDefinitely better picture qualityEasier option for toggling between snapshot and video modes (there's just a plain video button now)Things that got worse:As some reviewers have already mentioned, the buttons on the back of the camera are much more flush with the camera's body, so people with average to fat fingers will find a bit of difficulty operating them.  If you have pointy little fingers, ignore this.It's much more cumbersome to delete an image from the aforementioned buttons.  It used to be two presses of one button, now it's like three or four presses involving two or three buttons.  I haven't counted, but know it's somewhat more of a pain to delete.  This is possibly by design.  Maybe somebody complained about accidentally deleting too many images in the old system?Overall, great little camera.  For people who swear their phones' cameras are all they need nowadays, I guarantee you you'll think differently if you try this out for a quick vacation, event, or whatever else where you know you'll take a lot of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Small Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Matthew Schneider
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife as she wanted a small point and shoot so she wasnt using up all the space and battery on her phone. This camera has worked great for her. Very Satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife to easily carry and take quick photos.  We were both very pleased with the camera.  IS is good and color reproduction is good.  The wireless capability is difficult enough to use that it isn't worth our using it.  It's far simpler to attach by cable. I don't need yet another cloud storage area to manage.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Gal Friday
Reviews.Content: Love it -awersome pictures just need to learn how to use it.  I am not good with the technical terms.

Reviews.Title: Great pics at a small camera
Reviews.Author: Fernando Lemes da Silva
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera to take some pics when I can't take my Cannon T1i.It does the job really well and have a lot of cool features that allows me to have a great control of the result (i hate the auto mode.. :-P).

Reviews.Title: Canon Power SHot
Reviews.Author: marjorie tolleson
Reviews.Content: I will enjoy the really great new camera for a long time to come! I just took the first pictures. Good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Sadiq Shah Mohamad
Reviews.Content: The Picture quality is decent. I am having an issue with the powering on this device. Even if the battery is completely charged, i would have to power it a couple of times.This could be due to a faulty item i received. I will be contacting Canon and will update the review based on what happens.

Reviews.Title: great size and weight for travel
Reviews.Author: Beth Fox
Reviews.Content: have enjoyed the camera so far. still learning about it but Canon is always reliable and an excellent value for the price

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Tammy Cackowski
Reviews.Content: Still learning the camera but I'm having fun in the process. Great camera for families. Great investment for camera lovers

Reviews.Title: Great Small Camera!
Reviews.Author: Cristina Munoz "Mommy&Teacher;"
Reviews.Content: I use this camera in my Pre-K classroom... and it is GREAT! It has an autofocus feature that allows me to catch my quick moving students.  I was delightfully surprised by the hybryd video camera that takes video as you are trying to focus on your subject.  The class loves seeing the video outakes of our day. (don't worry... you can turn this off too... but it is a really fun option).

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gilberto
Reviews.Content: impressive quality photos,  simple for me, not to in technology takes crisp detailed photos my wife and i love it

Reviews.Title: Amazing Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my gorgeous Leica camera fell and broke. I realized that paying $600 to get it fixed/replaced just wasn't within my budget right now and I also felt like I wasn't using it to its full potential. I am an experienced casual photographer. Meaning I LOVE taking pictures of everything and anything and I carry my camera with me all the time, but I don't take the time nor do I have the energy to become more professional with my photographing. That's where this camera is PERFECT. Even just on the simply setting it takes amazing pictures. It works well in any light, especially if you select a particular setting from the options of pre-sets, and it's pretty simple to use. I would not recommend it if the selling feature for you is the wi-fi integration as I find that a little annoying. But it's a great camera for someone who wants a nice quality point and shoot that produces professional looking photographs. The price is right and Canons are great. I would absolutely recommend this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: MB lover "Microsoft hater"
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat for the price.  It may not have all the features of some, it is reasonably priced and works great.  10X zoom is usually not available in a camera of the price range.

Reviews.Title: Superb Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Bubbie
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to Washington D.C. on a trip with my grandson and used it to quickly send pix back to his parents and rest of the family. Took great pictures; easy to use and I stored it easily in my purse

Reviews.Title: Love camera!  WiFi hard to use and set up
Reviews.Author: Penny
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I finally set up phone and ipad with camera at home.  Couldn't get it to transfer on vacation.  The email function went thru the canon imageway but that was it.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Lorns
Reviews.Content: This is better than the last camera I got, a sony one.  The pictures are so clear and sharp.  I used it to take some pictures of  our faucet that needs a cartridge, in order for them to know the exact part I need to send the pictures to the manufacturer, the person who received the downloaded pictures said, that the pictures was so good, that it was easy for them to determine the parts to be sent.  So far I am happy with this camera.Portable Guy is excellent in their shipping.  I am happy I bought it with them.

Reviews.Title: Great small and lite camera
Reviews.Author: callum
Reviews.Content: Really good value for money camera that easily fits in purse pocket. I bought this for my wife and she has been really pleased with the results.

Reviews.Title: Starting
Reviews.Author: sylvia langley
Reviews.Content: Haven't used it much yet mostly because he directions for use are not simple and direct. Nothing like my Cannon

Reviews.Title: Bought as a gift and may buy one for myself
Reviews.Author: usar1984
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my son and his wife so they could get great photographs of my granddaughter. I almost bought one for myself and still may. I was impressed with features which I didn't recall even being mentioned when I was shopping for cameras.

Reviews.Title: size and zoom lens are perfect!
Reviews.Author: DONALD J FORT
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my new camera.  The zoom lens is wonderful!  I love the small size as it fits so nicely in a pocket and ready for use!

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: William L. Mroczka
Reviews.Content: The only issue that I have with this camera is, the buttons should be raised. I have big fingers and it is hard to keep from pushing more than one button without the others getting in the way.  Otherwize it's a great camera. I am enjoying taking a lot of pictures of our new grandson. If it wasn't for the buttons I would have given this camera 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. mynwife loves it
Reviews.Author: The Gear Guy
Reviews.Content: Quick photosfast focusnice zoomnice colors and te photos are naturalWell made and robustsmall and lightgood battery life

Reviews.Title: Elph is great
Reviews.Author: Get it Done
Reviews.Content: While it is incredibly small it is taking great pictures and I can't wait to use it at Disney World. How convenient.

Reviews.Title: WIFI a battle
Reviews.Author: michael hamilton
Reviews.Content: The shots are excellent and what you'd expect from a Canon; however, the WiFi connectiblity, which is a major reason I bought this camera, is a battle, which I haven't won yet. Even being in touch with Canon technicians hasn't solved the problem even though I have the required hardware as specified in the manual. Why can't things work as seamlessly as all Apple products do? Oh, well. If you are keen on the WiFi feature, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality camera for a low price
Reviews.Author: Noemi Szalavari
Reviews.Content: I am pretty satisfied with the camera. There isn't too much blur unless you can't hold it steady, and the images look nice on prints as well.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: Jack Foote
Reviews.Content: The Elph 330 must be out of production as the prices are low at this time.  It's a lot of camera that takes excellent pictures, has a 10x zoom and is one of the smallest cameras that Canon produces.  My only complains are:  due to the small size, the zoom is not easy to get to the exact setting and the flash cannot be programmed to operate on demand.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: tom75230
Reviews.Content: The best pictures often occur when you least anticipate their occurrence.  I used to tote an SLR with all its associated lenseswhich resulted in a cumbersome carry.  The Canon 330 fits almost imperceptibly in one's pocket even though it has a 10X zoom.Combined with an ultra-wide angle and a user friendly format once one gets used to it, it is an excellent camera to carry forphotos clearly superior to that of a smart phone. I have used it indoors on high telephoto with no flash, results being fairly good.I haven't used it that extensively yet, especially in video mode, but I have been quite satisfied with it so far, especially for itsdiminutive size.

Reviews.Title: best camera ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Eli Smith
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best camera i ever had before this i had a nikon coolpix s4300 that i did not like at all. i know they are coming out with a new model but it doesn't have all the shooting modes this has and this is much cheaper

Reviews.Title: Great camera for us!
Reviews.Author: Laura Crowther
Reviews.Content: This camera is all we needed to capture our memories.  Small and easy to carry and the pics/videos are great.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't include SD card
Reviews.Author: S. Matthews
Reviews.Content: I just got this and discovered that it doesn't include any SD card at all, so before you can use it you have to go out and buy one!  Would have been nice if the description had said that! It doesn't have an resident memory, either, so it doesn't function at all without one. Other than that, I just got it (and used the SD card from my Wii to try it out), so I haven't really given it a thorough test-drive, but it takes fast pictures (essential when you have kids) and they look to be good quality.  It's got a nice color profile in automatic setting, skin tones looks nice and warm, not too blue. I think I'm going to buy an extra battery (since this one charges on a wall charger - not exactly convenient when you're out on vacation), and it probably needs a nice case to tote it around in, it's much smaller than my last camera!  Definitely a nice purse or pocket camera, small and light!  The screen is clear and big and bright!

Reviews.Title: A GREAT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Marine Wife
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing, and the pictures I am able to capture with it ALL turn out beautifully! :) This is a must have for my family

Reviews.Title: I like Canon
Reviews.Author: Mohanad Mohammed
Reviews.Content: I like it too much it's very nice and feel comfortable when I use it because its light and small so I can put it in my pocket also I can get very very nice and clear pictures.Thanks Canon

Reviews.Title: enjoying
Reviews.Author: M. Fischer "animalstalk"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is just what I was looking for. I can fit it in my pocket and always have it handy for photos. I know........I have an Iphone and could use it but, for me, it's faster to use this little Canon. The photos have all been very satisfactory. We had  a HUGE ice storm, I got lots of practice with the camera and like the photos I got.

Reviews.Title: I really like this camera
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I took a few pictures with this camera and they came out really nice and the video did as well. It was going to be delivered on 2/13/2014 but there was a bad snow storm in the south and it was delayed by one day and that was fine with me as it was worth the wait. I can't put up much of a review yet since it is still winter here but I think the camera will meet my needs for the Urban Exploration that I do, and was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: Alan Foster
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for personal use but quickly found I had underestimated its value.  I am a novice when it comes to photography but with the features of the Elph, I can take snapshots for my blog and assist customers with their social media feeds.  I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to take great shots without hauling around a lot of equipment.

Reviews.Title: Nice size and feature packed!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan R Mason
Reviews.Content: I needed a new camera since my old Cannon G9 bit the dust.  I was hesitating about buying another Cannon since the way my other one quit on me.  But I liked the way the interface worked and up to the end the Cannon G9 worked very well and took excellent pictures.The ELPH 330 was an excellent replacement .  All the great features of the other camera but in a much more suitable size.  I have to say I love the size of this thing.  Picture quality is excellent and the rear screen is fantastic.  Features are pretty easy to get to.  I had read reviews about the buttons on the back being too small but,  I didn't find that to be the case.  Battery life seems to be adequate but, since I haven't put it though the paces of the G9 I don't know just how long a battery lasts yet.The price of the camera really cinched it for me though.  Glad I made the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great quality pictures, I just wish there wasn't a delay between shots
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera for me to replace my beloved Canon Powershot SD 750, which after six years of almost daily use broke when it was dropped on a tile floor. I was so sad because I LOVED that camera. I'm sure that it's apparent by the models I've chosen that I'm not a professional photographer, but I am a mom who loves taking pictures of my family regularly and I don't go anywhere without my camera. After extensive research in this price range, I asked for this model hoping that it would be as good as my previous camera. Truth be told it's not as great as the 750 but it's pretty close. The pictures are usually very clear and the colors are vibrant (I use the vivid option in the 'My Colors' tab). The picture quality is usually really good, but more often than I would like, I will get some blurry pics. That may just be something I'm doing wrong given that I'm an amateur. My only other complaint is that it doesn't snap the pictures as quickly as I would like. There's a delay between the time I push the button and the time the picture is actually taken and I often miss a "moment" that I was trying to capture. That being said, I'm pretty happy with this camera and I treasure the beautiful pictures that it's provided me.

Reviews.Title: Cannon camera
Reviews.Author: Roger Crozier
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the picture quality from this camera.  The pictures are clear in bright light and low light.

Reviews.Title: Very good Camera
Reviews.Author: KBeaumont
Reviews.Content: It arrived promptly and I am real satisfied with the camera. It is much quicker and has a better picture than the Sony cyber shot it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Love the features!
Reviews.Author: Skillswife
Reviews.Content: I have a large canon powershot camera, and needed something smaller to fit in a pocket or while hiking.  This was just the ticket.  The photos are fantastic, the zoom is great for such a small camera and the settings and features are a blast to play with.  I went with a canon because I have always had such fantastic customer support from them and have loved the other canon's I have owned. I did a lot of review reading but for me this camera was a perfect fit.  Did everything (and more) that I needed it too.

Reviews.Title: Best gift for my mother-in-law
Reviews.Author: misha69
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mother-in-law on her Birthday. She is very happy with it. Its easy to use and learn all the functionality. Big screen, long battery life and perfect size

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of wonderful features. The only issue I have with it is that it doesn't hook up to my wifi the first time every time. It does a eventually find it. it may be my wifi. I'm not really sure. It's an extra feature, but it's a fun one.

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera
Reviews.Author: S. Nelson "Online Shopping Addict"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera off my Amazon Wish List for Christmas.  I was telling a friend that I wish I had a couple grand laying around to shell out on an expensive SLR camera.  He sent me some pictures he had taken with an older version of this camera.  They looked AMAZING.  So I put it on my wish list and hinted...  I got it!  Let me tell you in Auto, this takes great pics.  I am a fan of the Vivid Color setting.  I love to take landscape photos.  I took a few pictures of the beach and some pelicans and seals and a few close ups of some of my plants and posted them on Facebook.  I got so many compliments.  People said they looked like professional photos and that I need to blow them up and frame them.  I am definitely going to do that and that is one of the reasons I wanted a good camera in the first place.  The quality is amazing.  You can blow up pictures as large as 16 x 20 if one is to purchase this camera for the same purpose as me.  I always keep my camera in my purse.  The colors you get with this things is phenomenal.  I took photos for a house for listing purposes and got compliments on my photos.  It's great.  I don't know what you're waiting for, buy it!  If I can find out how to post my pictures to this review, I will.

Reviews.Title: Canon quality
Reviews.Author: Dennis Sather
Reviews.Content: Excellent optical, plenty of digital, the right size and feel, good software.  I'm totally satisfied with Amazon, the shipper and the price.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power shot
Reviews.Author: Frugal shopper
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. Still learning how to use everything on it.  It was a good deal and it takes great pictures and it is nice to have the WiFi feature.

Reviews.Title: fun
Reviews.Author: Carol Lindsay
Reviews.Content: Very light, clear pictures. I haven't quite figured out all the things you can do with this camera. Took me awhile to figure out how to use the timer. Thus far that's as fancy as I've gotten with it. I like that it fits in my pocket on trips.

Reviews.Title: amazing cmos sensor, amzing zoom both close range and distance, do not get tricked by the megapixel, the sensor is the key
Reviews.Author: Fabio Lamberti
Reviews.Content: the closest u can get to a DSR, dpi 180 this is the most difficult info to find so I hope it helps.if you want to upgrade to any phone picture this will be a huge step up. do no get anything except cmos sensor.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera packs a punch
Reviews.Author: Fortylove
Reviews.Content: My main camera is the Canon 6d, but I wanted something compact for work and general carrying around.  The wide angle is what drew me to the camera and it hasn't disappointed. The 10X zoom does a great job too. Works well in low light and the battery life is very acceptable. Thinking about buying an extra one for my wife !

Reviews.Title: Had to have it!
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife one some time ago and when my pocketable camera got lint inside the lens I decided to get one like hers, but in another color. It is so easy to take anywhere and the image quality is all I require for what I use it for. If I'm going out specifically to shoot I take it as a backup to my larger cameras.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my Dad
Reviews.Author: thancr
Reviews.Content: My Dad's camera was so beat up the lens flaps didn't shut anymore. This is basically the newer model of what he had. Considering how rough he treated the last one I'd say that the overall quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera - compact Powerhouse
Reviews.Author: Linda Brock
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon Elph. It is top of the line with strong optical telephoto lens and programmable functions. I like to shoot landscapes on VIVID and can control the flash, aperture and speed of shot. Great all round camera and fits in my pocket. For big jobs, I use my canon SLR.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 330 12MP Dig Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Coe
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera  because my camera of 6 years died.Am enjoying using the camera. Still have to read the entire manual to see what all its bells and whistles are.Excellent camera at a great price. Thanks Amazon.Kathleen from Ronkonkoma, NY

Reviews.Title: Highly recommend this camera
Reviews.Author: jon
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera as all of my other Canon cameras are as well. So simple to use and has great pictures. I didn't think I wanted the longer zoom lens as I normally don't value Zoom. Image stabilization is exceptional and bring faraway shots close and clear.I am also impressed on the Wi-Fi capability. Syncing with my iPhone in less than one minute. No router or external Wi-Fi needed. Simple camera to phone transfer works very easily with simple set up. I would highly recommend this camera and looking forward to exploring more of it's features.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Engineer Bill
Reviews.Content: This is a good capable camera and takes good pictures.  I bought it for my wife and she had one problem of getting the switch in the wrong place so that it takes a short video with each still shot.  She has learned to check it each time.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket-size digital camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald Kruis
Reviews.Content: Superb quality pictures and videos from this camera.  Another really good achievement by Canon.  I've never been disappointed with their cameras.  Its pocket size is very handy.  It would be nice to have a little faster recovery time between pictures, but this is a minor complaint.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Feline Lover "feline lover"
Reviews.Content: The size is perfect.  It easily fits in the palm of my hand and I am a female.  And the pictures this camera takes are great and detailed, even in low light conditions.  Also, when taking videos, and zooming in and out, the videos come out very good. I have not used it on the internet yet.  I have not had the time to figure that feature out yet.  But I am really satisfied with this camera.  Definitely, a great point and shot camera.

Reviews.Title: Good replacement for older camera
Reviews.Author: cnndog
Reviews.Content: We had an earlier version of Canon Powershot, that got dropped. this was purchased as a replacement, and it words as advertized. We will be using it during our travels this Spring.

Reviews.Title: does a real lot of stuff, well
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: Owned for 3 weeks. I am new to digital cameras, so taking awhile to understand all the fantastic features. A drawback con I see, which has no real great solution, is that the lens has its' shutter exposed to outside all the time. Be careful to not damage that, so must be in a good case when not being used--quite delicate throughout. NOT a camera to just toss in your pocket or purse. Note; has a great bright flash.

Reviews.Title: Does the job
Reviews.Author: Alan H. Siegerist
Reviews.Content: The price was right and it takes good pictures.  I need the point and snap features it has.  Still learning to use all features.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330
Reviews.Author: Harley William Montelongo
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas present using the specification the individual gave me.  It met or exceeded every requirement she had.  She also has a nice Nicon full size digital camera and takes a lot of pictures.  She said that this camera is a great alternative to the larger version that can be taken on trips, etc. where weight and bulk are an issue.  Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great features and better picture quality
Reviews.Author: Milton N. Burgess
Reviews.Content: I use the Canon for my work and have found it to be reliable and easy to use. Each time I change to a new model Canon I am impressed by the improvements made in light gathering and easy of use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent "Point and Shoot" Camera
Reviews.Author: DHI Andrews
Reviews.Content: We needed this camera to take comprehensive, sharp photos to use for safety procedures, and it does exactly that. Somewhat wide angle, the WiFi technology is spectacular, and the file transfer rates are fair. A+ Canon.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Gandalf The Grey "Gandalf"
Reviews.Content: In addition to Ultra High Resolution Pictures it records video at 1080p (Blu-Ray) Quality and in 30 frames per second which is better than Blu-Ray (which is only 24fps)!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Melanie Bray
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures.  Easy to use and compact enough to take it anywhere.  Bought 3 of them.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Shebby!
Reviews.Content: I am big into photography and this camera does a pretty good job. I have a bigger DSLR camera but I like to use this one for quick photos. Plus the video quality on this camera is amazing. The color of this camera is also a plus.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Teddy Striker
Reviews.Content: It is extremely easy to operate and takes excellent pictures and movies.  It's small and easy to carry and store, like most cameras in this class, the lens retracts and automatically closes, so you can put it in your pocket or bag and not get gunk on the lens.  Best camera I have seen for a casual photographer.  Worth considering for more experienced photographer who wants something ultra-compact, although from what I have read, the S series may be superior for thatPros:Easy and effective automatic modesGood quality moviesLong zoomPriceWifi feature (facebook posting)Cons:Need to use 720p for movies to avoid slow framerateLens is slow at longer focal lengths (don't zoom in low light)Battery life is fair/ok and you need to remove the battery to charge it.Wifi functions are a bit cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330 12.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Image
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product! It looks very solid and very good.  It is inexpensive.  You will not regret to buy it with such price.  Highly recommended! I will buy it again.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: andrew yang
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera for my girlfriend and she loved it. I myself can't give a review for it, but every time i ask her she says she loves it.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Gerald Uttrachi "Jerry"
Reviews.Content: my wifes 3 year old Kodak was taking poor pictures in low light situations, much worse than her cell phone.  i have a higher level model Canon  but this one was priced right and simplier for her to use.  She like this one very much and it takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Takes Great Pictures, but Eats Batteries
Reviews.Author: Weird Ralph
Reviews.Content: After much research, I got this camera as an anniversary gift for me and my wife. Overall, we've been very satisfied with it. It's got a lot of advanced settings that we're not really taking advantage of, but for the most part, we get perfectly good shots by putting the switch down to the "manual" camera mode and then selecting the "auto" setting.My only gripe is that it sometimes takes a longer-than-expected time to get ready for the next shot, and it tends to go through batteries very quickly. This is easily compensated for by charging a few extra batteries and taking them with you when you plan on taking several pictures.Bottom line: We like this camera well enough that we got another one as a Christmas present for my parents.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera nice pictures
Reviews.Author: David Steen
Reviews.Content: Would buy this camera agine the wifi works great take a pic and sent it to a device easy and its very light weight

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey R. Myers
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I was dissatisfied with the pictures from my phone but didn't want to weigh down my purse with a nicer camera I own.  So, I bought this and have used it quite a bit with excellent results.  At first, I was confused because I kept getting short videos in addition to the pictures I was taking, but I learned the easy fix for this "feature."  I was able to get some great pictures on a recent trip to Hilton Head Island of wildlife on the beach and in the interior of the island (much different lighting conditions).  It is also much better than my phone in low-light conditions.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: It's worth to buy it!
Reviews.Author: Victor Craciunoiu "vic50us"
Reviews.Content: Small camera, It has met my expectations.Unbelievable nice HD movies for such a small camera!More reliable than other brand similar cameras.The battery last long time.Quality of photos is very good!

Reviews.Title: Nice pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Victorm "Victorm"
Reviews.Content: A good pocket camera which does what it is meant to do. Do not expect SLR results for this price. Great snap shooters tool.

Reviews.Title: perfect!
Reviews.Author: Kate Petzold
Reviews.Content: This little camera was just what I was looking for. It's size allows me to carry it in my purse, backpack or even pocket. It has a enough settings but also a great auto set. I was looking for two things in particular - 1) I wanted a low light camera to catch shots of my small grandchildren and not distract them and 2nd I wanted a decent zoom. Although, this camera can do many other things including stringing still shots into a small video the two items I was looking for were on the camera for a decent price. It has a large window for viewing and shoots clear pictures. I haven't had it long but so far am very satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: Like this camera
Reviews.Author: Scouter5446
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Love that it has ability to connect via Wi-Fi to download pics to computer. Compact with nice zoom.  Battery lasts long time too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: VICTORIA
Reviews.Content: I have been buying Canon camera's for many years and pretty much wear them out!  I like having the same battery size and similar functions on my camera's.  Ever since finding my first "pocket" camera I rarely ever use a larger one.  These little cameras take fantastic pictures and have good battery life in my experience.The only issue I have found so far is how to downsize the pictures easily for sharing - I'm sure there is an easy way to do it just haven't gotten through that learning curve yet!  I have not tried the wi-fi setup so I can't comment on that.  Overall it is a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: stars suz
Reviews.Content: 2nd Canon Elf. Easy to use. Takes great pictures.  Highly recommend to someone who wants to take good pictures without the stress of all the adjusents first. Just aim and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Just what I had expected
Reviews.Author: IwinYouwin "iwinyouwin"
Reviews.Content: My Canon 880 died but I have liked Canons and it was an easy transition to using the 330. I wanted the 20x zoom of the SX280 but was scared off by some of the problems reviewers were reporting. The Elph 330 was my second choice and it had terrific reviews that appear to be well earned now that I have used the camera for all of our Christmas pictures. I must admit I really have not had much of a chance to try out the advanced features yet but point - zoom - click right out of the box works great!

Reviews.Title: Worth
Reviews.Author: vijay somaraju
Reviews.Content: It give good quality photos within this price range. Good for beginners. I liked it and doing experiments with it. :)

Reviews.Title: Mac Users: Read this!
Reviews.Author: Tom L. Pittman
Reviews.Content: Mac Users:This is a great camera, but getting it to connect to your Mac via wifi is frustrating enough to make you want to box it up and send it back. I'm posting this in the hopes of helping others get their cameras connected to their Macs with less hassle than I had.I got this camera for my wife for 2 reasons.(1) Because PC Magazine made it a 2013 Editor's choice, and(2) Because my wife wants to transfer photos from her camera to her MacBook Air via wifi.We don't want to view photos on an iPhone, we don't want to post them on Facebook, we don't want to share them on Canon's ImageGate website... we just want a great camera that shares files over wifi with a MacBook Air.Canon's clueless Mac install starts with the DVD that ships with the camera, and continues by making it hard to find the software downloads you need on their website. Canon further confuses things by having their own proprietary, branded names for things making it so have no idea what they are talking about.Because most modern Macs don't have DVD drives anymore, here is what you'll have to do.(1) Go to Canon's website and create an account for yourself (if you don't already have one). Don't register your camera yet; that comes later.(2) Download the Canon software from the URL I'll put in a comment to this review (Amazon doesn't allow us to put URLs in our reviews, but allows them in comments).(3) Install the software you download just as you do any other Mac software. That install app will install the various Canon apps they want you to have as well as walk you through registering your camera's serial number (found on bottom of camera).Interestingly, the app you need to run on your Mac so you can exchange files with the Canon PowerShot Elph 330 HS will not even run on a Mac unless your camera is in the process of discovering wifi computers on the network. Consequently, you'll need to walk through the menus on the camera and get it on your wifi before you can run the Canon software on the Mac.But with the camera set to find the Mac, and the software installed on the Mac, you'll be able to use peer to peer networking to have the to talk via wifi.

Reviews.Title: Love love love it !!! Super easy....Beautiful pictures....
Reviews.Author: R. Brumley
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera to everyone...Super easy , beautiful pictures.....A must buy for everyone....I just love it so much...

Reviews.Title: Perfect high-quality point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Marcus G. Hand
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 80+ year old mother - she wanted something that was light, easy to use, and takes good pictures.  Well, this is all that and more.  The large, clear LCD panel is easy to see, the zoom at 10x is nice and versatile, the lens and sensor combo quality seems great for such a small device, and the anti-shake technology also works well.  You can just set it to auto-mode and let it do its stuff with great results.  Finally, a point and shoot is much easier for her to hold and use than a smart phone, as well as producing consistently better results.  She and I are both very happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great packable camera.
Reviews.Author: William F. Mackey
Reviews.Content: Camera was exactly what I was looking for in a light weight packable camera. LED screen is easy to view indoors and out. Picture quality is excellent. Very powerful zoom lens for such a small camera. This is a perfect addition to my Nikon D3100. I would recommend this camera for anyone looking for a moderately priced camera that can be put in your pocket for that quick day trip.

Reviews.Title: Good replacement for ELPH 310 with added features and capability of using accessories from the replaced camera
Reviews.Author: Dipak
Reviews.Content: I had a Powershot ELPH 310 camera which I recently lost during a travel to Canada.  I had several accessories of that camera which I can use with this later model camera.  That is the reason I bought the camera in the first place.  After purchasing I found the operation of this camera I somewhat different from my previous camera due to additional or changed feature.Based on the experience I gathered to operate the camera so far I like it.  Some of the features, particularly the setting up of the WiFi is little complicated, and I am still unable to set it up.  Instructions given are not that easy to understand.Although the camera is compact to fit in a pocket, I wish a lanyard of longer length to hang from the neck was available also, so that I would not have lost my previous camera..

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: scc1234
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with this camera.  It really produces and at a great price.  It is very easy to use and the picture quality is great.  It does a great job in low light and keeps the camera shake to a bare minimum. The optical zoom is amazing.  I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! Upload pics from anywhere!
Reviews.Author: S. Matthews
Reviews.Content: My favorite feature of this camera (which I still can't quite understand) is that it broadcasts a network that I log into on my iPhone, I open the canon app, and then I can transfer pictures to my phone and upload everything to Facebook, Instagram, etc.My mom yells at me "just take the picture on my phone!" but since I can just take them on my Canon camera, transfer them, and then text them to her... HOLY CRAP. I've almost converted her. The quality is amazing and it is very easy to use.There are a few features I wish it had. I wish it took perfect nighttime people-pictures. I wish the video record button wasn't separate from the picture-taking button. But the pictures are so clear, the videos are more vivid than any I've ever taken, and I have found that I don't miss the typical camera mechanisms as much. I've had this for a few weeks now, and I know I will continue loving it.Great freaking camera!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Akash
Reviews.Content: Good camera to use. Had all the features I was looking for. The charger works in other countries too. Good

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted.
Reviews.Author: L. C. Pocock
Reviews.Content: I am replacing a Canon SD700 IS.  I wanted an easy inexpensive point and shoot camera.  And I had such good luck with Canon (I had tried other major brands) that I tended towards this one.  I am amazed how much camera you get for the money!  Seriously. The ELPH 330 is lighter weight, thinner and takes sharper pictures than the older SD700.  The format was basically the same as the old camera.  As I said in the title line, this camera was exactly what I was looking for.  Inexpensive, small foot print and easy to use.  It has facial recognition (!) which I will probably never use.  It can transfer pictures wirelessly - however you need Windows 7 or 8 (I'm still happy with Vista) so that feature will be appreciated when I have to replace my computer.  All in all I had expected to pay nearly twice as much for a camera like this one so I feel like I stumbled onto a really good deal.  Totally pleased.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Kaus
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife's Birthday and she loves it. The wifi capability makes this camera very attractive. We transfer pics from our camera to our IPhones in a matter of seconds using wifi.

Reviews.Title: Works great, just as expected.
Reviews.Author: a-dude
Reviews.Content: Over the years, I have used many point and shoot cameras and I had the best experience with Canan Powershot ELPH's. This one is no different. Woks great, very handy. Wifi capability is very useful.

Reviews.Title: Canon software not compatible with Windows XP SP3
Reviews.Author: Larry Young
Reviews.Content: The ELPH 330 is a great little camera and creates wonderful HD movies.  However on Windows XP there are two significant problems.  First, Windows Movie Maker on XP does not support the .MOV movie format.  Therefore you'll need to purchase additional software to edit your movies.  You can upload them and edit on Youtube but their editor has limited functionality.Second, the software bundled with the camera, specifically ImageBrowser EX, apparently is not supported on XP and does not run.  Canon technical support has not been able to resolve this issue.Bottom line is that I'm keeping this great little camera and upgrading my computer.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Holly Butler
Reviews.Content: Super cute, i love the colors and quick to take pictures of my toddler, fast shipping and looks just like the picture

Reviews.Title: East to use - Wifi capability
Reviews.Author: GiantFanSF
Reviews.Content: A good quality point and shoot. Large screen. Best feature: download Canon's phone app and upload camera pics to your phone in seconds!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: fabriciosouto
Reviews.Content: Excellent Camera, I'm enjoying a lot! Very powerful and high quality of the images e movies. I recommend it for everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Tahira Benevelli
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures and it is a good deal. However, connecting the Wifi has been difficult and I haven't been able to get customer support.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, small, great pictures.
Reviews.Author: Sy Lee
Reviews.Content: Purchased this item as bday gift for my Wife.. . She loves it! hands down one of the best digital cameras for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great for me
Reviews.Author: curious BG
Reviews.Content: Fast 'on' and fast 'time until ready to shoot', plus large true (optical) zoom, while fitting easily in shirt pocket, makes this a great choice for me and better than my iPhone camera. There a few other features that a I use occasionally like rapid shooting, but the main things are what I have mentioned.  It was great for my 17 day Europeon trip and for capturing my grandchild's "moments".  I had one of these cameras stolen and I just had to get another.  I have used cameras and done darkroom work but never anything commercial or intensive.Incidentally, I have used the wireless features but don't find them so useful. Nice to occasionally have the GPS feature but is not inherent in the camera and will mark your photos only if connected to a GPS smart computer 'source'. Its easier to just do it in iPhoto later unless you need absolute correct coordinates.

Reviews.Title: Pink lightweight camera with great zoom
Reviews.Author: SATXLady
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera for travel with higher zoom but still small and light weight.  Also, I really like pink.  This turned out to be perfect.  Small enough to carry (if it's too large, I leave it behind) but great zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great For Youtube
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: I Love this Camera, Its the Best Ever!!!! and it can even record in up to 1080P. Come check out a few of my Youtube Videos that I recorded with this camera. [...]

Reviews.Title: Small and easy to carry is a major plus.
Reviews.Author: Dale L. Clark
Reviews.Content: Yes I like this PowerShot 330 very much.It's small and slides right into any pocket you care to put it in.I am not a avid photographer and use this for various snapshots of this and that.Works great.....photos to me look are great. Controls are easy to learn.I do not use the wi-fi feature....I am just not into social media photo sharing at all.I tried a full sized DSLR cameras once......way too big and bulky for my uses and for my untrained eye, the photo were not discernible one way or the other.

Reviews.Title: A good camera that is convenient to carry.
Reviews.Author: Joseph R. Walton
Reviews.Content: My purpose for buying this camera was to capture decent pictures with a very portable device.  This camera satisfies this need and brings with it amazing flexibility.

Reviews.Title: Elph
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Smiley"
Reviews.Content: Camera has large screen and wifi capabilities.  This is my third elph.  The second one died after about 10,000 images.

Reviews.Title: Take it everywhere
Reviews.Author: Charles C. Bayley
Reviews.Content: It's nice to have a SLR but they are hard to carry everywhere.  This camera is small enough to carry all the time so you don't miss an opportunity.  The still and video quality is great.  The only drawback I have found is not being able to turn the flash on manual.  I am trying to find a workaround.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Roger Haley
Reviews.Content: I was tasked at work to get a nice point and shoot. I had the Canon ELPH SD630 a few years and I loved it so I knew a Canon would be good. I was waffling between this model and the ELPH 320 with the touchscreen. I opted for this because I didn't see a touchscreen as necessary for a camera. I like having the buttons to access the menus.The camera takes great pictures and videos. It seems to lag too much after taking a picture with flash. I removed the feature that captures 3 seconds when the picture is taken to make a daily movie because I thought that was it. (Nice feature by the way, but I don't see it as necessary because it takes up too much memory.) It seemed to help at first by now still lags.Overall though this camera is great and I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Jack T
Reviews.Content: First let me say I like this camera.  Nice size, takes decent pictures and was well reviewed on other, not Amazon, sites.
