It's actually my wife's camera, and she carries it in her purse and has already taken several hundred pictures, plus several videos.  All in all a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: MMoses
Reviews.Content: We needed a small camera for vacation, it worked great pictures are clear.  Still getting use to it but so far great.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT REPLACEMENT FOR MY SIX YEAR OLD ELPH
Reviews.Author: Alan C. Nash "Loral"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Elph and is superior in every way except it does not have a optical viewfinder; needed in bright sun.  But none of the completion does either.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Wei
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for what I bought it for.  It's compact, easy to carry around, and takes good photos under most lighting conditions.  I also like the camera effects tool which can take a photo in black and white, miniature mode, and many more.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: hvogt
Reviews.Content: I love it!  2nd one I've had.  First one broke and I wanted it again, so I bought it from Amazon.  Best price here.

Reviews.Title: Fits in pocket
Reviews.Author: RLL
Reviews.Content: This is about 1/3rd the volume of my last compact. I really don't like to carry or use a camera. But this does the trick when I take the occasional snapshot. Also easier to use than my Nikon Coolpix - which only partially worked after one year.

Reviews.Title: A must for novices and the few that don't own camera phones
Reviews.Author: Rz
Reviews.Content: Perfect camera for novice picture takers with all its built in features. Ability to send instantly with its Wi-Fi feature makes this camera a most for anyone that doesn't have a camera phone.

Reviews.Title: Takes great photos
Reviews.Author: Robert N
Reviews.Content: You'd be amazed at how much more you get in a photo with the 24-mm wide angle lens.  This Canon takes great photos, it focuses quickly, and overall I've been pleased with its performance.On the down side... the plastic housing feels cheap, unlike the old-school stainless steel Elphs.  Also, I would have liked a raised thumb grip.  The buttons are all flush-mounted on the back. I've inadvertently hit the 'view photo' button on several occasions.I have yet to attempt uploading photos wirelessly from this camera, but will update my review as soon as I get to it.

Reviews.Title: Difficult menu
Reviews.Author: David Silvan
Reviews.Content: I would have given this camera 5 stars, and then some. The size, the weight, the image quality, the feature, the zoom range and the design are all great. But the reason for the 4 stars is that the menu is a challenge to navigate and understand. It isn't friendly at all and the manual included in the box doesn't help much either. Most of it addresses WiFi, which seems to be the fashionable thing, but if you don't use this particular feature, the user is left pretty much in the dark, other than for the very basic AUTO functions. Other major competitive brands have Canon beat in this respect. But, so far, I like the camera and will enjoy using it. I'll just have to spend more time figuring out the menu and memorizing the obscure paths to the settings.

Reviews.Title: I love, love, love this camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Always keep your words soft ...
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for some technical stuff this is not the review to read...I bought this camera because I am a cake decorator and take pictures for my website and blog. All the cameras I have were given to me by my sisters as their hand-me-down to their upgrade. I decided I will spend some money, not too much to get a good camera I could take fairly good pictures with. After tons of research and asking questions of friends who take pictures I was overwhelm. I figure it would either be a Canon or Nikon. My sister just bought a top end Nikon $$$ and I thought I would get a Canon so we could compare. Along with this camera I ordered a used Canon ESO DSLR Rebel XT for starters and I got this PowerShot to immediately jump right in...I am blown away by the many things it can do!!! I have posted pictures I have taken, cropped and adjusted (on the camera) to Facebook. It was a cinch! I love the Wi-Fi on the camera. I have not tried printing yet because I don't have a Canon printer. The use of Auto and Programed to change different things about your picture in amazing. I am still learning because but I am looking for a DVD of instructions because I learn better, seeing, hearing and touch.I will try to update this review. I would recommend this camera to anyone wanting a small camera that's packed with punch to take beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Applegate
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  Fast recovery from picture to picture and great picture quality.  It has so many features and mode it does require you learn some of the modes.  Have had the camera now about 3 months and have no problems.

Reviews.Title: Great: Size, Performance, Features
Reviews.Author: Curtiss Monroe
Reviews.Content: My ELPH 310 was stolen early this year. It was no longer available (at least, at a reasonable price).I looked and looked for a replacement, and when the 330 became available, bought it immediately, just before a vacation.I love the size (slides into any pocket), performance (wide angle to long zoom, picture size choices, quickly ready to shoot), and features (quite a few overrides of "standard" so can take good pictures in difficult lighting conditions).Small negatives: The performance should not be compared to SLRs - picture taking is not instant, but it is adequate. There is no full manual for shutter and aperture - but that is rarely needed.

Reviews.Title: I adore this Camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Theobald "Mizzely"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for me.The shutter speed is quick enough for most things; if it's sunny out, you can easily capture action shots on full automatic with just a button press. I primarily use my camera indoors, and still have good results.The size allows it to sit in my pocket without issues.I usually can shoot a few photos, turn the camera off for a few days, then do a few more, etc etc... and my battery lasts me a few weeks like this. For me, that is usually all I need. I did also take it to the zoo with me, and the battery lasted the entire day. So it definitely can do both.The Wi-Fi was really annoying to get to work; I couldn't get the website to sync with the program on the computer. Once it is set up, though, the camera is able to upload to the Canon Image Gateway, Facebook, etc, even from a different hotspot. I really like the feature!Overall, I really don't have anything bad to say about the camera. It is a great point and shoot for the casual user.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: E. Leone "Sue"
Reviews.Content: The camera performs much better than I expected. It is easy to use and download the photos to my computer.

Reviews.Title: Love the size!
Reviews.Author: Jojo
Reviews.Content: Great size, haven't got to use very much yet....but so far so good.  Can't wait for my trip to Ireland to really get to use it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Alice Mullane
Reviews.Content: My friends made fun of my the first time that I brought this out - everyone is so used to using their SmartPhones in this day and age.  But when it's dark, a smartphone doesn't provide the best flash.  We took over 100 pictures that night, and the best thing was waking up the following morning and realize that the camera takes video clips right before the picture is taken!  I'm in love with this camera, and it's color!  I would highly suggest this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: I love everything about it
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Horstmann
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon PowerShot, my husband has one also.  I have tried other popular cameras over the years and we always come back to the ELPH because it's features are easy and many and it just takes fantastic photos.

Reviews.Title: Love the color!
Reviews.Author: Dee "Aiea Mom"
Reviews.Content: Besides the color, I like the features. It has a big screen on the back, light weight and simple to use. My other Canon camerabroke and I had to go back with a Canon because I like the looks of it and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: Believe the great reviews!
Reviews.Author: RCF "RCF"
Reviews.Content: It's everything they say.  Great little camera.  I would buy this camera again.  My 20 year old daughter loves it.

Reviews.Title: Super camera for a modest priced point-and-shoot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my niece as a birthday present and she's been taking wonderful pictures with it and loves it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome !!
Reviews.Author: Judy Holland
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera !! It is small so it fits easily in my handbag or even in my pocket. The clarity in the pictures is awesome !

Reviews.Title: Wow great by
Reviews.Author: janetO
Reviews.Content: Am very happy with this camera, it is easy to use, takes excellent photos, great honest and true colors, great for kid photos!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera with good functions for the price
Reviews.Author: I. Fairooz
Reviews.Content: Wish the WiFi function would perform better. Great pictures, especially in daylight. Not the best with low light yet but adequate for most purposes. Great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Elph 330HS
Reviews.Author: lulu46
Reviews.Content: I dropped my pocket camera in a cup of coffee. Even though I have an iphone, I decided to replace my Canon SD1100 is with the Elph 330 HS.  I love it, plus it is Wi-Fi enabled.  Very easy to use and the photos are great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Camp Man "Camp man"
Reviews.Content: Great camera at a very good price.  The only negative I have is the wifi.  While it does work, it clearly needs more work.  However, the photos and zoom are both exceptional at this price level.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kyle Swanson
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. Takes wonderful pictures. I only wish it had some manual settings but I knew it did not have them when I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Dave Richardson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, nice pictures, good zoom range.  However I had some confusion about turning on the flash manually.  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: It's a snap
Reviews.Author: granny23
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera based on good reviews. It did not disappoint. Pictures came out great and it easy to carry and store.

Reviews.Title: It takes great pictures in a very small package.
Reviews.Author: CAMPJEEP
Reviews.Content: Very good image quality, good auto white balance. The iso between 80 and 800 is very good for such a small sensor. The 330 has a nice sharp lens even at the telephoto end of the zoom.This would be a great camera to take to Disney...I just really like the colors in the pictures that the canon cameras produce, again that's just me thinking out loud.I set the disp overlay to grid lines to help take a straighter picture, You may use it for the 1/3 rule also. A nice backup battery is a (power2000) for canon NB-4L (900mAh)$19.00 or less. I have used them for years. I think your new battery will do a little better after the first couple of charges.Update 7/29/2013 We went to the ohio state fair today 988 pictures taken, 4 short movies and we still have battery left. 10  of the pictures used the flash.The movies turned out beautiful and I noticed fast good focus and great Image Stabilization... I used continuous shooting in program mode most of the time. The camera handeld fast action ride pictures very well without blur.I do not use the wi-fi and (I do not use the new hybrid auto that utilizes a combination of Smart AUTO and Intelligent IS to create a beautiful and steady 720p HD video clip in Movie Digest mode every time you shoot a still image)To much to think about, ha ha. I do use smart auto and it works great.I use program mode most of the time,thats just me tho...I am no expert and I am trying to be honest here and help out if I can, these are just my thoughts.*Look at some of the pictures that I and others have (posted on this site) if that would be helpful and check out the other reviews on the canon 330 or (Canon IXUS 255 HS over seas).A lot of the review sites blow there pictures way up and look for defects, your likely to only make 5x7 or 8x10s and not see what they see.If your new to this digital camera stuff remember to low level format the SD card first thing.( Save your pictures first, doing this will also erase all your pictures).Cons : No camera is perfect.This a nicer,softer camera strap > Nikon 25770 AN-CP19 Black StrapThis is the case I use the most.>Case Logic QPB-201 EVA Molded Compact Camera Case (Black)I mostly take pictures of bear in the Smokey Mountians (CADES COVE) and love chasing the grand kids around taking their pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great feature in a compact size
Reviews.Author: Jun Yanai
Reviews.Content: First off, let me start off with the Cons.  When I purchased this camera from Amazon, it didn't function at all.  I guess there is a common error code among the newer Canon Lineup where the camera lens sensor has a firmware/hardware issue.  It shuts off after 30sec of use.  So I ended up sending it back for a replacement with no hassle.Now, onto the good part.  It is nice and compact with lots of features I didn't expect to see in such a small device.  The new Hybrid shooting option actually does quite well adjusting to the environment to focus on target with good results.  The resolution isn't up to par with other maker in the same price range but anything over 10mega pixel, you won't see much difference unless if you are planning to photo edit.  Comparing to other manufacturers, the features that comes with Canon out does them all.

Reviews.Title: Zoom Perfection
Reviews.Author: Bright22
Reviews.Content: According to my previous experience with other cameras, I am truly, recommending this particular camera as perfect for all weather shooting.

Reviews.Title: WIFI didn't work.
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with high hopes.I wanted a camera that had a number of features:1. It could fit easily in my pocket.2. It had Wi-Fi so that I could email and upload my pictures from the camera. to web storage.3. I wanted a good zoom.4. It had useful features.5. It took good pictures.The ELPF 330 HS failed on counts 2 and 4.I had read troublesome reviews about getting the Wi-Fi to work, but thought I had enough experience and aptitude with computers to get it working. I failed on every attempt, including three long telephone sessions with competent and helpful Canon technicians.  They had me do many things beyond what the users manual described, but nothing worked.I suggest that you contact a Canon technician by phone as soon as your first try for Wi-Fi fails.I'm putting one star back because it was so quick and easy to contact the phone technicians, and they tried so hard to be helpful.I returned the 330 HS and bought a Samsung WB 250 F.Less than one minute after I had put the battery in, I took a picture, pushed the Wi-Fi button, found my home network, entered my WEP number, my email address, and saw the email on my computer with the photo.What a simple pleasure.  That cost Canon two stars, because a Wi-Fi camera that can't do Wi-Fi is not a Wi-Fi camera.Another star was lost because of some annoying features, and lack of some features on the camera. I knew the camera did not have shutter and aperture priority, but I really missed having it. What is the point of having a short exposure time if you can't guarantee it?Now that I have tried both cameras I find the Samsung more user-friendly, although using advanced features on either camera requires careful use of the user's manual.I had not originally chosen the Samsung WB 250 because several professional reviews had said that it's photographs were not too good, especially compared to the Canon 330. But I am happy enough with what I see, even on a computer screen, with my Samsung. I think the professional reviewers, to their credit, use all kinds of sophisticated software to find technical imperfections in the camera's pictures that I can't see. I do not expect that I will want large professional posters, so I am satisfied with what I have seen.Whatever camera you buy, you have to do a number of things before starting.1. Order an SDHC memory card in the same order as your camera.  I bought a Sony SDHC 15 GB class 10 card for about $15 from Amazon.2. Download the manual from the camera website, and start getting acquainted with the camera.3. Make sure the battery is charged before starting with the camera.4. Format the memory card. It is a little hard to find out to do this in the user's manual.5. Make sure you save all the original wrappings in case you have to return the camera.Good luck with whatever camera you buy. One good point is that it is so easy to work with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: John T. Lockner
Reviews.Content: I still haven’t learned all the new features of this camera, but my initial pictures are phenomenal for a small point and shoot.  It’s perfect for activities/days when I do not want to carry my large DSL Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camera but...
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Hidalgo "Bolon 50"
Reviews.Content: WI-FIThough a recent, loudly touted "feature" in cameras, it is one of very little value as far as I'm concerned. Sending pictures to yourself makes little sense, nor does spamming social media direct from a camera. Images of interest that are sent along invariably benefit from a bit of thoughtful review, light cropping, and so forth. The grand benefit of frenetically rushing to send an image of a bowl of oatmeal straight to Facebook under the guise of "sharing" somehow escapes me. While perhaps theoretically useful for professional engagements where you'd like to show images to clients immediately, it serves mostly as yet another way to needlessly drain the battery of a compact camera.

Reviews.Title: memory card **requried**
Reviews.Author: noah peal
Reviews.Content: am i the only one adled enough not to realize that ya gotta buy an SD card if u expect to use this thing?d'ya think canon / amazon could have said somewhere, in the above heavy-duty product promo, "hey, meathead, ya really wanna purchase one of these-there SD thingies, in addition to the camera, elsewise it aint gonna be of much use to ya."they include the battery.  they include the on/off switch.  they include the lens.  would it have killed their profit margin to include a 50-cent 128MB card?!i've got no objection at all to buying an SD.  but it woulda been kinda user-friendly if they'd mentioned that i really oughta do that....

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Gerry
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this Great camera and the whole process was smooth. Thank you for the expierence. Have a good day

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Bill Chelmowski
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures.  The only problem is that it is so small it is hard to handle.

Reviews.Title: A good deal foor my family
Reviews.Author: Jean Côté
Reviews.Content: price and qualityrecommandation by a magazine of my country PROTÉGEZ-VOUS who tested a lotSmall, Pocket size,battery charger and WIFI

Reviews.Title: Convenient camera
Reviews.Author: Emil And June Styffe
Reviews.Content: It is frustrating to have the picture delayed after pushing the button. I had one before, and  forgot about that issue. I like the other features.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Adan Monreal Torres
Reviews.Content: I got what I paid for.Good quality pictures for the best price.Compact design.Would of been better a smaller size but I couldn't find it but it's ok.

Reviews.Title: An Amazing Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: Charizard
Reviews.Content: It is quite honestly the best digital camera I have ever had. This camera takes super clear photos and videos.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: chalk
Reviews.Content: love this little camera.  I needed a nice small camera for traveling as I didn't want to take my big slr.  takes great photos and does lots of things

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Woody
Reviews.Content: Love the camera, although I wished it had more memory. Have to consider that the camera came at a fair price for what you get

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the snapshot photographer
Reviews.Author: Roland Creed
Reviews.Content: this camera is compact and light, has good zoom range, good speed and it takes great photos. the camera is is very easy to use

Reviews.Title: Great but....
Reviews.Author: DeeanneWat
Reviews.Content: This is the THRID TIME I have tried to write this review and Amazon keeps messing up so this TIME I'm gonna make it short and sweet.First for mommies who are looking at this to buy for your busy kids, I say YES GET IT! It has the High-Speed Burst setting that takes back to back photo's with no lag what-so-ever. The other setting's seem to do pretty awesome too. The auto setting does will with them too.  When I first opened this package I thought my camera was grey because it was in the box with a grey camera on it and to myself I was thinking "NO! It better not be my party is in two days!!" well no it was pink lol! Next I LOVE THE SIZE! Its so tiny compared to my other 3 year old Canon Powershot. There wasn't anything wrong with it other then, it didn't get the photo quality I was looking for with my babies. NOW for my normal landscape shot my older kind is still great.Down side. The Wi-Fi...Its not really that hard to set up like everyone say. The booklet makes it hard. Call the customer service to clear up any confusion you may have. They are great and speedy. Now the downside....YOU CAN NOT be in one room taking photo's and select the ones you want and send them wirelessly to your computer like they say, THAT IS ONLY WITH PRINTERS AND SMARTPHONES! When you send them "wirelessly to your computer" what they mean is, you set the camera next to you and you have to be sitting AT THE COMPUTER anyway. So connecting with the USB seems easier to me. So that really disappointed me. I wanted to be outside taking photo's and be able to select the ones I wanted for safe keeping then and send inside to my computer but you can't do that.  Other then that I haven't any bad review for it. Its great, light, and able to go into any of my pockets without the need of a case to carry it with me (though I bought one to keep it safe anyway) I like the fact that its a battery pack its smaller to carry the 'extra' battery without bulk...though I miss the fact that I can't just run to the store when I'm out and about and get AA's and have it going then.  Overall good camera and GREAT for moving babies and toddlers!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Marty
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific small camera that has more features than you will find in a phone camera.  A really quality camera, yet small enough as to not be cumbersome.  Got it for my wife, she loves it, I'm tempted on getting my own to always have with me.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Derry
Reviews.Content: Canon is the hands down best option for compact digital cameras.  Competitive products sometimes have flashier features, but the best pictures is usually from the Canon product.  Indoor photo taking in poor lighting is a challenge for any digital camera, but Canon is conquering this problem with its new camera.  The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because the the Wi-Fi is awful.  Get used to "Connection Failed" messages.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: M. Moise "Magalie"
Reviews.Content: Got it for my daughter to go to summer camp she loves it , loves the color , myself I have a nikon slr , never got a canon camera since I'm a nikon fan but I wanted to try this camera with everything it offered . I don't regret we went around our country took nice pictures can't wait for her to come back from camp to see what she has been up to ... Very happy it's compact , takes nice pictures

Reviews.Title: A great little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: lakeportauntie
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced my 5 year old Canon SD1100 that was stolen while on vacation in Guatemala. The camera takes crisp, beautiful photos. It's great for someone like myself who will carry this everywhere every day. The manual basically explains how to set up the camera for AUTO use only. Nothing mentioned about the different settings! I signed up for a 3 hour class locally to understand a little more to get the most for my minimal investment... For the price and the quality, this is the camera for someone who wants to carry a pocket camera rather than a smart phone in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful small camera
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: I love the ease of use of this camera. I always buy Canon PowerShot Elphs because they have all the features that I'm looking for.The only problem I have is that I find it hard to share pictures with other people - most of the time it doesn't seem to work. It was also long and tedious to set up this feature.

Reviews.Title: Impressive camera
Reviews.Author: Sarah Frantom
Reviews.Content: The camera definitely performs in low light, and the auto setting works wonders! Colors are great, features are easy to use and the size is perfect. Two quick gripes; what happened to the wide screen option and the CD-ROM/online PDF owner's manual is awful...at least provide a quick look guide with the camera itself discussing shooting options. I purchased this days prior to a long trip without internet access, and had to wing my way through learning the camera without a hard copy of a manual. Luckily, it is quite similar in many respects to other Canon cameras I have owned with regards to the menu settings.

Reviews.Title: ALL HEADS ACCOUNTED FOR!
Reviews.Author: Mary Navin
Reviews.Content: I am not very good at taking pictures so my daughter suggested this camera.  I LOVE IT! The size is just right. I am getting such wonderful pictures of my grandchildren that even my daughters are now using MY pictures and down loading them onto their computers.  This is quite an accomplishment for me because they were always teasing me about all the pictures I took of them as children with their heads cut off at the tops or them never being in the center of a picture.  It is so easy to use.  I am thoroughly enjoying it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Katz
Reviews.Content: Excellent small camera, very good product which is good looking and takes great pictures.  This is my 4th Canon camera and I love everyone I have.

Reviews.Title: Best small camera ever
Reviews.Author: Jeff Madden
Reviews.Content: Best small camera ever - perfect pictures and video, without needing to know photography, every time. I have the EOS 7D and this is just as clear! x10 optical zoom and rapid frames - how can you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera with amazing clarity
Reviews.Author: Christopher R. Murphy
Reviews.Content: My wife has an older version of this camera and loves it, it has a few more features but has less zone. I am very happy, now I just have to protect from my wife's thievery!

Reviews.Title: I am an Elph convert
Reviews.Author: Gary_72653
Reviews.Content: My previous camera was a Canon EOS large body camera with removable lens. I loved that camera also but it was large and did not disappear when no longer needed.  I have a very small pouch I wear on my belt that carries this camera with spare battery (needed).  The camera takes excellent pictures and has lots of programming that can modify pictures and it will also take video.  I was on vacation last week and could discharge a battery in just over a day taking several hundred pictures and turning power on and off many times through the day.  I expect that each time the camera is turned on / off the "lens extend / lens collapse" electronics use a fair amount of power.  I have nothing bad to say about this Canon camera and I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Debrahow
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what I wanted!  A good Point & Shoot that is affordable and takes sharp pictures.  It has a lot of settings to chose from.  Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Had it for 5 minutes want to throw it against the wall
Reviews.Author: M. Christie
Reviews.Content: Registering for the image gateway is a royal P.i.A.Getting the WIFI menu apparently requires you to install software on your PC, then it requires you to activate "web services" to be placed on the camers.TO THE IDIOTS AT CANON: MEMO: I DO NOT WANT TO GO THROUGH THIS CRUD AND HAVE TO USE YOUR CRAP SOFTWARE WHEN I USE IPHOTO. WHEN I OPEN THE BOX I WANT THE THING TO WORK. NO DOWNLOADS, NO SETUP, NO PLUGINS....I WANT IT TO WORK OUT OF THE BOX>Now, i download the software because apparently the geniuses at Canon are from last century and don't realize I DON'T HAVE A CD PLAYER IN MY LAPTOP. IDIOTS. I don't know where it is.So I download the software, plug in this camera, follow the instructions in the manual and iPhoto is moving up-and-down and the canon software says "this version of camera is not supported". WTF? So, I go to try and move the program to the trash. It won't let me. I try to see if there's an uninstaller in the pkg. There isn't. So now I have to contact Canon and have them remove this crap software from my MAC.I ONLY bought this camera for the reviews and for the WIFI. If this is what it is going to be like to get it to work I warn you to stay away.If it's easier than I am making it out to be, please find a way to contact me.

Reviews.Title: Wifi not for humans
Reviews.Author: Richard.
Reviews.Content: The only thing Canon seems to provide is a set of screenshots when everything is going perfectly in some lab conditions that don't exist in the real world. If anything goes wrong, their advice is to 'check the receiving device settings.' Gee, that was helpful.As far as my WiFi is concerned, the thing is connected. As far as the camera is concerned, it is able to find the correct PC (which presumably also means it is connected, unless it is psychic). What does it do after that? Sits around spinning a little wheel and eventually puts up some pointless error message that says nothing useful. That is all you get folks. No support, no help, no sensible messages.So here's the question: Do I really want to spend 8hrs trying to figure this out? I don't think so. Pictures look good so far. I am just not sure why they bothered with WiFi that probably only works for the lucky few under ideal conditions.Update: Now that we have had have had some time to use it, the camera is pretty nice. We will probably buy another one. It is very light and the zoom is good. I don't think we could usefully employ more zoom than it has.One thing we both found annoying were the default focus settings. The thing highlights multiple ever changing focus areas. Neither of us could figure out what the point of that was, especially as we know what we want to focus on. However, after configuring it to P mode, changing to a fixed focus point, and enabling the zoom focused area, we are both really happy with how it works.I am still having some trouble getting close ups to focus correctly. That's still a work in process. If I do get it to work right, I expect the pictures to be pretty spectacular.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: B. Michael Johnson "MB J"
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use and transfer files to PC -- great photos and images.  Nice compact size and quick to get out on turned on to capture those once in a lifetime shots.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in the instructions of how to link with various computers and ipaads
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Weed
Reviews.Content: Needs a user to work engineers to write manual for camera interface language and instructions with various computers.  Frustrating to try to upload the pictures, should be a click away, but is not.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot camera
Reviews.Author: R. Davies
Reviews.Content: Its a good camera and arrived as it promised within 4-5 days however,I would suggest that the company mention on there site that it is going to cost me extra £33 on arrival which I didn't expect to pay and put me on the spot so, I would have not purchased it if I know that was the case.

Reviews.Title: Good pocket size camera and good picture quality but the battery needed to be replaced after three weeks of use!
Reviews.Author: CommomSense
Reviews.Content: Good pocket size camera and good picture quality but the battery needed to be replaced after three weeks of use!Battery problem was irritating. First, it started while taking photos overseas. The error messages ranged from battery needed to be recharged - battery charger light would keep changing sporadically from no light to green to red - to lens related error messages. The seller - beach camera - pointed me to the Canon Customer Support who was not able to pinpoint the root cause for the problem and wanted me to send the camera back for them to examine it. I took a chance and bought two halcyon batteries which took care of the problem.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: WAYNE N.
Reviews.Content: camera is really a nice camera, it takes very good pictures an downloads to my computer with great ease to me

Reviews.Title: Not great picture quality
Reviews.Author: SG87
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take with me when I travelled to Europe, so that I wouldn't have to worry about losing and packing around an expensive DSLR. The size is great, it is easy to use, and it is really lightweight.However, the picture quality was disappointing.I was originally using the auto setting, and decided to change to the specific settings to see if that helped anything, but it didn't. There were only a handful of decent quality photos, but easily comparable to a much cheaper camera. Zooming in and night shots? Don't bother.I ended up losing the camera three weeks before the end of my trip and had to take pictures with my tablet, and most of those pictures ended up being better quality than the canon powershot.It's good if you want a cheap, lightweight camera to throw in your purse, but not if you want to take good quality pictures. You'd probably be better off using your phone.

Reviews.Title: Canon PS
Reviews.Author: DuncanHynes
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for an older ELPH.  I thought the buttons on that were bad, these are so flat and flush they are hard to use, shame on Canon.  But the dumbest thing ever is the new Hybrid shooting mode that another user note; an absolute waste of time, function and real estate.  This isn't for me though, for my wife and in auto-mode it's just a nice point and shoot with HD movie mode capability.  The door is plastic and the last ELPH we had was constructed of mostly metal though I'm not sure if the battery door was.  I would call this average but these days unless you spend over $250 that's what you pretty much get.  If the buttons were raise and the Hybrid mode was dropped this would be a much more effective device.  Yay Amazon, boo hiss Canon.

Reviews.Title: Useful sugestions if you buy.
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Very good buying. Camera is phenomenon, sound is very real. Recording renders beutiful pictures. Overall, very good camera for family use. Some suggestions, buy an extra battery so that you don't wait when battery is charging. Buy a 32G SDHC C10 card casue you will find 16G card can only hold 1080p video less than 1 hr. And, I suggest people buy a tanscend SD+MINISD card reader if you dont have one, using the white data cable that comes with the camera to transfer huge files from camera is a pain in the ass cause it not only will continue to consume your camera battery while you do that but also won't supprot copying anything more than 500MB accroding to my test. Oh, one more thing, 1080p video you can only record maximum 10 mins due to a limit of file size. If you compromise to 720p or lower resolution, surely you get more recording time.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mother Zucker
Reviews.Content: My daughter is so very excited about her new camera!  She is starting her own YouTube channel and this camera has all the functions (plus some) that she could ever need or want!  Arrived on time too!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 330 12MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa D. Jameson
Reviews.Content: I got it just in time to take pictures at my grandson's birthday party. The pictures were good quality and due to the WIFI I could post them on the internet for the rest of the family to see. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Love the speed
Reviews.Author: Bethany Bell "Beebug2002"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pics, hi speed burst setting is awesome for taking pictures of my little guys, looses a star because the battery runs out too fast, defiantly worth the piece of mind to spring for the backup batteris and keep them with you when going places that you will want lots of pictures of.

Reviews.Title: Easy & good quality point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Jeanie Nguyen
Reviews.Content: It works quickly and is simple to use. Picture quality comes out nice, not like a DSLR or anything but very close and super sufficient, especially for the price you pay! Highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Take good picture in low light, BUT battery always die very quickly!
Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, small, thin and light, taking great picture in low light.The rest of other brands can't perform as great as this.I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because the battery which always die very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera value I have found
Reviews.Author: Denny
Reviews.Content: Because I also have a ELPH 310 and a bunch of other digital cameras, I think this is perfect. Haven't played with all the features but expect the best. In my stock of cameras are canons, Sony, Olympus, Nikon and the canons are the easiest and best for my all the time use. I give 5 stars because this under a $150 camera is so far superior to over $500 cameras from a few years ago hat in am amazed.

Reviews.Title: Handy
Reviews.Author: Gaz Loren "Gaz"
Reviews.Content: A bit hard to hold and operate with one hand, but it is very handy, anyway. Night shots are hard to get...

Reviews.Title: Really enjoying my new camera!
Reviews.Author: Aileen Rivas
Reviews.Content: This canon camera is what I wanted and is performing as I expected. Have yet to tried all its features.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: merereid
Reviews.Content: I have another camera - much more expensive with all the bells and whistles.  I bought this one to throw in my pocket just to have with me without worrying.  Well, I find myself using  this camera more and more.  It's amazing and the pictures great.  A great buy.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330
Reviews.Author: James Pelrine
Reviews.Content: We bought it for our grandson to have during his school semester in London. I can only assume the feedback from him.

Reviews.Title: Vacation saver
Reviews.Author: Areva
Reviews.Content: This camera was easy to pick up and start shooting great pictures. It was small/light enough to easily carry without getting in the way of having fun. The auto focus allowed me to get some great shots as the trolley sped past sight after sight. No need to stop and juggle with focus and stability. The battery life was a little disappointing. I had to recharge every night. It didn't last more than 24 hours at a time. Still, I would recommend this camera. It saved me from lugging around my heavy 35mm SLR.

Reviews.Title: picture quality
Reviews.Author: Luc Van Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Normal light photography (indoors and outdoors) ---> I found that this camera did a very good job with color reproduction in normal light conditions or outdoor photography. The colors were less blued and yellowed than from our phones. Like most cameras, if it can't perform here, it might as well not be sold. So I wasn't "impressed" by this to say the least.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!, but not stoked ...
Reviews.Author: Alexis Puente Cifuentes "Alex."
Reviews.Content: i had an elph 100 first, and i was stoked with it's features and photo qualities. This camera has almost the same features and some more, but i don't see too much improvement from the elph100, except from the zoom that it is much powerfull, that's the best part for me, But if it wasn't for the zoom may be i would prefer the elph100. I'm just starting to use it, we'll see if it gets better ...

Reviews.Title: Good stuff, light and slim
Reviews.Author: Tintin
Reviews.Content: Good stuff, light and slim, like it till now! A little bit thicker than ELPH 110 HS but still good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: Great choice!
Reviews.Author: ohionurse
Reviews.Content: We've have several cameras.  This one is great due to the convenience of charging the battery.  Just wish it had more megapixels.

Reviews.Title: Great Size
Reviews.Author: Tex
Reviews.Content: Love this camera fits in my pocket and works just fine.  Pic quality is equal to any expensive camera. I never did figure out the wifi will try again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Dan PCFL
Reviews.Content: This camera is what I was looking for, it fits into my pants pocket or shirt pocket. The pictures and HD Video are very high quality. The flash is not powerful but considering the size of the camera you can not expect too much. The camera has a nice feel and the controls are user friendly. My only complain is that the display on the back of the camera is hard to see in bright sunlight. I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Extremely limited options
Reviews.Author: Irene Kellner
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a tiny point and shoot that takes excellent pictures with a long zoom in common situations this is a very good choice.  But it has very little options for settings.  For example: With flash you have "Auto" and "Off" so you can't force fill flash.  I opted for the Nikon Coolpix S9500 instead.  More expensive and slightly larger but basically is a pocket version of my SLR (with some limitations of course but a longer zoom).

Reviews.Title: Unable to see LCD in bright sun.
Reviews.Author: Susan Obrien "Shutterbug"
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this camera except that I can't see the LCD in bright sun to compose a picture, see the subject, or review what I may have shot.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Jane Varn "Crime Aficionado"
Reviews.Content: I like the easy handling, but found the newer features difficult to master.  Took too long to figure out how to adjust for lighting, focusing on where I wanted the shot, and odd resistance to close-up shots.  PowerShot Guide not as easy to read or master as with previous Canon PowerShot camera.  Also, camera slips into movie mode way too quickly and with no warning.  All, in all, a nice camera, but somewhat challenging to adapt to.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but the battery is strange
Reviews.Author: Bob "Bob"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera about a week. I went to Gettysburg with the camera. The fully charged battery worked all day, no problems. I brought the camera home and left it by the computer after transferring pics to the computer. The next day I went to open the camera to use it again. The battery was dead. I recall reading that you should not leave the battery in the camera for a long time. Overnight is a long time? There is a warning about the camera losing the date if the battery is not left in...The date will disappear after 3 weeks and will take 4 hours to reappear after you put the battery back. So the camera drains the battery while it is off and if you take the battery out for more than 3 weeks the date will be lost. Hmm I guess this means put the battery in at least every 3 weeks and then leave it in for 4 hrs. Other than the battery problem the camera is great.

Reviews.Title: it's good
Reviews.Author: chenyue
Reviews.Content: i buy this camera to replace my old camera-- canon A610,this new camera is all better then my old camera.the only shorter is the battery can't use enough time ,maybe 100 photoes must change the battery.

Reviews.Title: an interim camera?
Reviews.Author: Lorraine in Taos
Reviews.Content: I like it, but....  First let me say that I love Canon P&S; cameras (in this price range) and I kept this one as long as I could before returning it. At the end of the period of testing, I was still unsure of what to do. The zoom is great, the picture quality (my top priority) is excellent for a compact. However, I reluctantly returned this one for two reasons. One is that the video button is so close to the edge of the camera (where most photographers tend to hold cameras of this size) that it inadvertently gets turned on when taking a still shot -- it's annoying and happened repeatedly. The second reason is that the 12MP and the wi-fi (which I couldn't figure out how to set up or if I really wanted or needed it - my iPhone does it better) had the feeling of an interim device. I am certain that Canon will come out with something beyond the 330. If you're a social media type, take and share lots of videos and don't care about the other things I've mentioned, then this camera does take excellent pictures. It's just not for me. I'll wait for the next iteration.

Reviews.Title: Good.  Not spectacular
Reviews.Author: Michael Yip "Realname"
Reviews.Content: SUMMARYGood all around.  Simple to use pocket camera.  Low light is good.PROS- Works well under low light condition- Details is good - not too noisyCONS- No HDR mode.  Some high contrast situation is not as good as smarter cameras.- Color is not vivid- LCD screen is below average- Only 10X zoomI am comparing between Sony WX300, Panasonic ZS25 and Canon 330 HS.  Sony WX300 has a lot of noise (when you zoom in the details of the JPEG photo) and a lot of distortion.  Canon's color seems to be the most washout and it does not have any HDR processing.  The Panasonic ZS25 seems to be better in most aspects but it is the largest camera.

Reviews.Title: I'm done with Canon.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: First off, I shoot Nikon semi-professionally.  This was my 4th ELPH from Canon, which I've always loved and recommended.  I've always loved Canon for their small pocket cameras (over Nikon).  This camera was a huge disappointment, and I returned it.  Image quality was poor, compared to previous models, and software to activate the Wireless, could not be installed, even after trading SEVERAL emails with Canon support.  I'm a UNIX engineer by trade, but I refuse to bypass security measures built into Microsoft Windows to get a commercial software installed.  Canon couldn't give me a way to "Run As".  I tried using Run As, and even opening a Power Shell as Administrator, NOPE!  Canon support refused to acknowledge the issue, even after I provided screen shots and URLs of several others having the same issue.  Canon will NO longer be part of my wallet.  I used to endorse the ELPH cameras to everyone that asked my opinion.I replaced this with a Sony WX300.  I just got it today, so no review yet.  Initial tests are promising!

Reviews.Title: NOT Canon quality
Reviews.Author: tinner
Reviews.Content: Possibly the worst Canon camera we have and we have a lot of them.  Pics come out blurry, exposure is poor with flash, controls are very difficult to locate (not where they seem they should be), no printed instructions, sometimes the lens cover sticks, just bad all the way around.  There are lots of excellent Canon cameras, but this is not one of them.  I'm sending mine back after one day of shooting.

Reviews.Title: Do not bother
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I thought I was getting good deal but the camera keeps shutting off claiming battery needs charging (when it is fully charged!) and it was made in China while all my previous Canon cameras were made in Japan, this was bad surprise. And Canon website does not even have this model in their list for addressing this issue. So, I am using it but I am not happy.

Reviews.Title: Sharing pictures a pain!
Reviews.Author: Caryopteris
Reviews.Content: I went to download pics off this by myself onto my computer at work, expecting that I could download select pics for work and then go home and put the other pics on my home computer and also share with family members.  NOPE!  It gives you no options.  You can either download the whole thing or none, and then it's wiped clean.  How useless!  I haven't used the camera again!  I may as well use my dumb phone for pics!  Ripoff.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy If You Intend to Go Anywhere Near Water
Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of research, I thought this camera would offer me the best of both worlds.  That is a great camera for indoor use, while with the plethora of waterproof cases that Canon offers, an equally great camera I could use while snorkeling or enjoying the surf in places I will probably never have a chance to go back to.  However, I found out only after I purchase the camera that Canon does make waterproof cases for the 300, 310 and 320 models, but not for the 330.  There is not even a generic after-market case for it.  Quite frankly, not only do I feel I have wasted my money, but I feel bitterly disappointed that I won't be able to capture some of the high points of my travels.  I hope to at least pass the word along so others don't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad vacation camera
Reviews.Author: Mel P
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on vacation as I did not want to carry something big.  It works fine and has a lot of different settings.  The pictures look good when uploaded.  I have not used the wireless option and prefer to just download pictures from the card.  The battery last a day when used often.  It also takes nice video.The problem I have is that after just one week of use, the shutter wont fully open and it seems that the battery has somehow become loose.  When I turn it on, it will give a charge battery or shutter error.  It is easily fixed by taping the shutter with your finger or reinserting the battery but who wants to do that.  I have not yet tried to contact customer service regarding this so I can't comment on that.  If not for these issues I would give five stars.

Reviews.Title: Overall its good camera
Reviews.Author: Saurabh Kumar Gupta
Reviews.Content: Like : Clarity in light, zoomDislike : Photo quality is not good when dark is there.Hence overall rating is 3.

Reviews.Title: ELPH 330 review
Reviews.Author: don headley
Reviews.Content: The indoor photos are not as sharp as I expected when I compare then to my camera. Recharging is not as easy as I expected. There is no recharging cable. I had to purchase a spare battery to have backup. Battery must be removed for recharging.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Battery Issues
Reviews.Author: Jessica C.
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera twice, the first time they sent the wrong battery and now the second camera they sent me is having battery problems too. Even when fully charged the camera will not turn on at times and sends a message I need to recharge the battery. It has caused me to miss some great photos. The camera takes wonderful photos and is easy to use, but when it is malfunctioning one in every 8 shots, it's really not worth it.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great for its size.
Reviews.Author: Kindle is #1
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good photos.  It is compact and fits easily in a pocket or purse.  It is easy to use and the battery lasts quite a long time.  The 10x zoom is adequate for this size of camera.I would highly recommend getting this camera if you are looking for a compact camera that takes good photos.

Reviews.Title: New digital camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera, relatively cheap but appears to have good optics.  Although I have owned Canon digital camera in the past, there is still a learning curve for the operation of it.  Time will tell if I like all the features or if any are missing.

Reviews.Title: A32 camera error
Reviews.Author: Sandra Harris "Sandra"
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these camera for our kids for Xmas gift. One is working great the other one keeps erroring out on A32 error and restart the camera. Not sure what is going on. Contacting the dealer and see what can we do to get this camera by Xmas.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with the Wi-Fi
Reviews.Author: Donna A.
Reviews.Content: Can't get the wi-fi to work - the Canon tech didn't get the problem resolved.  I have spent HOURS trying to get this to work.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen G Riley
Reviews.Content: The small buttons are a bit of a challange for an old timer.. It takes great pictures, I have not set up the WIFI yet, first things first. Small and EZ to pack. Shipped very fast after release by Canon. I LIKE IT.

Reviews.Title: Screen failed within 35 days
Reviews.Author: ABQautoxer
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife for a vacation with her mother. On the second day of the trip the screen stopped working. Upon her return, the display screen started working again but quickly failed again just after the window to return to Amazon. As a happy Canon DSLR owner and several PNS versions before this, I'm sorely disappointed and warn others to consider another model and perhaps brand.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed....
Reviews.Author: RICH CHUMBLEY
Reviews.Content: By the time you push the take picture button and the time it takes the picture, you messed the action or shot.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot 330 elph
Reviews.Author: jim k
Reviews.Content: this is my first camera in years.it is very nice just point and shoot on auto.if you turn it to VIVID  setting oh my its nice on colors.only thing i did not like and gave 4 stars was BATTERY LIFE  is not good.also you wont believe this but it takes a better picture inside WITHOUT  flash .everytime i use flash i get dark areas along edge of picture.found out my finger was over flash on some picturesso it was me on flash thing.i suggest you get spare battery .its slippery to hold in cold outside so make sure you use landyard around your wrist.also get screen savers too for over screen in case you drop it.other than battery life its very easy to use and gives your great pictures.jimafter trying the camera it has problem i dont like.SLOW SHUTTER SPEED.what happens it takes long time for it too take picture.the subject of picture can move and you lose great shot.this is not problem with a fixed object but for live object like my dogi lose real neat pictures because the shutter takes foreveer it seems to click.so i lowered my stars to a 3 star rating..jim k

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Shirley Keating
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed in the fact that Canon has chosen to produce a plastic camera, my older Canon  Powershot S410!s case was a high grade aluminum and lasted a long time, my husband is an older man and is not used to the lack of view finder in the form of an eye viewer.

Reviews.Title: Problem with lens cover.
Reviews.Author: gapsmimi
Reviews.Content: Lens cover does not open and close properly.  Purchased this camera June, 2013.  Immediately took camera on vacation and problem started.  Have now waited too long for return or exchange and couldn't find way to communicate with company about issue.

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the price
Reviews.Author: Jason Pintinalli
Reviews.Content: So far I love the camera and for a great price. I've only used a few times, but plan on using more instead of my bulky Digital SLR.

Reviews.Title: Very frustrated!
Reviews.Author: David P Emmerich
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace my canon 310, which I loved until it was dropped on the concrete. Anyways, this 330 is constantly telling me my battery needs charged, even when it is fully charged - requiring me to constantly remove and put the battery back in - missing the picture I was wanting to take. Then, as I'm pressing the button to take the picture it will randomly decide to zoom in to the max, again causing me to miss the shot I was wanting. It began as an occasional problem and has become more and more frequent. It is now being sent in for repairs. We will see how it is when it comes back.

Reviews.Title: Canon elph 330 HS
Reviews.Author: Victor S.
Reviews.Content: Not user friendly for an amature. Good pictures if and when you are able get it set up. Mine was supposed to be new but came with a Chinese battery which may be okay I don't know. I know there is no way it would come even close to 200 pictures as Claimed. Iran the battery down just trying to get ready to take a picture, and I would say I would be surprised if it even took 30 to 50 pictures while using the flash. You have about 85 pictures to get started and another hundred and 50 or so explaining the camera. It may be a decent camera if I can ever figure it out. I can't get over how weak this Chinese battery is, and it is about useless.Someone's

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: E "MASTER"
Reviews.Content: Gave this as a gift and my sister loves it. have not used it myself but she hasnt had any complaint about it to me

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera - got bad battery
Reviews.Author: Outtatoone
Reviews.Content: It works - not the best but will probably be my last Canon.  Pictures are nice and camera is small.  I'm 60 days in and battery goes dead usually only after a few pictures and at the most inopportune moment.  I called Cannon and they want me to ship the camera back - really?  All that trouble for a battery - but they claim they have to 'test' the camera or determine if something in the camera is draining the battery; you figure they would check this before selling it, right?  Anyway, I got a TX30 Sony for my daughter - so I will probably be purchasing something like that in the future.  The screen is much nicer and it's touch and appears to be much more durable.  Good luck w/your purchase.  By the way, I got a G-9 pretty expensive Canon camera and that just quit working after about 5-7 years - which is why I had to replace it w/this one so I am done w/Canon.

Reviews.Title: Don't count on any warranty
Reviews.Author: Greg Jackson "Engineer / Manager"
Reviews.Content: I have not had failures after owning a series of Cannon PowerShot pocket cameras.  Now this one fails to start on occasion.  Still under the manufacturer's warranty, but the repair/replacement will be 82% of the cost of the camera.  What sort of warranty is that?  They make no claims that I abused the camera, or that it is out of warranty, it's simply stated as their standard warranty replacement cost.  At that price, somebody should kiss me, cuz I like being kissed when I'm getting.......

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Joe A.
Reviews.Content: I find the quality of the pictures not sharp enough ...  should have gone for a higher megapixel camera.Plus some features not easy to navigate

Reviews.Title: Recieved broken
Reviews.Author: Alexander Parise
Reviews.Content: Camera automatically turns off after a minute citing error code E32.  Essentially unusable.  Bought it as a present and now I have to try to get it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Decided to return it
Reviews.Author: D in Texas
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful little camera.  But it's just a little bigger than a phone.  I wanted something that doesn't slip out of my hand too easily and feels less fragile.  I settled on the Samsung WB250F, a smart camera that feels like a camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera shut down suddenly
Reviews.Author: hari824
Reviews.Content: The camera shut down suddenly. I ask Amazon for a change and they immediately replaced my first camera with a new one, but the new one has the same problem. I think is a defect of some models maybe. What I think is that the battery is not thigh enough, so sometimes camera lost the power.

Reviews.Title: Not right for me
Reviews.Author: Baobao "Baobao"
Reviews.Content: The picture is yellow-tinged and crook because the wide-angle effect.  The video is ok but the voice recorded is hardly heard.  So I returned it to BestBuy.  Compared to my Casio Exilim EX-Z600 which had have been used for 6 years and recently died, this one is junk.

Reviews.Title: Dark shadow in bottom left corner with flash
Reviews.Author: A. Ward
Reviews.Content: I would have given this camera a 5 however now that I've taken pictures with the flash I simply can't recommend it.  The lense somehow blocks the light so there is a dark corner in every picture.Bummer. Loved this camera otherwise.Amazon has told me this is an isolated case. I love this camera so I will buy the same one and try again.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Ingrid Sapona
Reviews.Content: I've only had the camera a few days -- but so far I like it. I had a similar camera so I was pretty used to the interface. I can't figure out how to do basic editing with film, but that's pretty minor at this point. I've also not tried the WiFi interface (seems too much bother at this point).

Reviews.Title: it's okay but has issues
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and has the standard Cannon interface I am use to.  It shoots fine but is slow between shots.  I installed their software and now it does not import the pictures when connected via USB.  I have not used the wifi part due to my network setup because my desktop and wifi are on different networks.

Reviews.Title: No camera for Christmas.  Thanks Canon.
Reviews.Author: clcawc
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Canon and their complete lack of customer service, I won't have a camera for Christmas.  I bought one of these for a once in a lifetime trip to Greece.  It was great...when it chose to work.  However, I repeatedly got the error message "Battery not charged".  This was accompanied by a black screen and resulted in the camera being unable to take a picture.  it occurred frequently and totally randomly - even when the battery had just been fully charged. I sent the camera back to Canon and they responded extremely quickly (great, I thought) by sending me a "new" camera.  I received it yesterday.  Today, I tried to make it work.  Yes, it takes pictures but then, each and every time I have turned it on, I ultimately get the message "A camera error was detected.  Camera will shut down automatically.  Restart camera.  E32".  Canon sent me a camera that was even worse than the one I sent them!  I called Canon (again), spoke to Sandi, a supervisor, and explained what had happened.  I asked, given that I had purchased a bad camera, had sent it back to them for repairs, and that they had sent me an even worse one - with clearly no quality control at the repair center - to replace it by sending me a new - not refurbished - one that I would receive before Christmas.  Sandi told me that she couldn't send  me a new camera.  All she could do was send me a shipping label and that when they received this second bad camera - after Christmas - they would send me another refurbished - not new - camera.  However, she did tell me that she would make certain that it was inspected before they sent it to me.  Great.  That makes me feel better.  The bottom line is that these moments are fleeting.  I have four children and unless I choose to write this camera off and spend a couple of hundred more dollars on a new one, I won't be able to capture these memories - the exact reason one owns a camera in the first place.  Sandi and Canon could have done the right thing.  Instead, they have alienated a long term customer and caused him to write his first ever review on Amazon.  Hopefully, others will learn from this.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but won't print diectlty via wi-fi to almost all wireless printers
Reviews.Author: Trustme "notapundit"
Reviews.Content: The reason I purchased this particular camera model is because the product description states, "print your photos to Wi-Fi® compatible printers." Well, it turns out that isn't really the case. I wanted to be able to print photos directly from my camera to my recently purchased "wireless WiFi" Cannon Pixima 6220 printer (a model that's still being sold by Canon)via WiFi, like I can already do with my iPhone. Very convenient.After fooling around with both the camera settings and the printer for a whole day, I just couldn't get it to work,  The printer and the camera both recognized each other over my WiFi network, but printing just didn't happen. I contacted Canon Tech support and was told that WiFi direct printing from the HS 330 only works with the newly updated version of the printer I just bought, the Pixima 6230. All previous wireless printers sold by Canon(or anybody else) are not compatible. You can do things like post pictures via WiFi to Facebook or transfer files to your PC but not print directly to almost all the wireless printers Canon(or anybody else) has ever produced. That's silly.I am very disappointed with Canon on this. First, if I can print directly to my Pixima 6220 from my iphone, why couldn't Canon engineers make that possible using one of their own cameras? It sure looks like they are forcing you to buy a new printer to do this, rather than making the camera backward compatible. Second, and inexcusably, if WiFi direct printing only works with a couple of Canon's newest printers, and not with any of the Canon WiFi wireless printer previously sold, why wasn't that made clear in the ad for the camera & the compatible printers listed in the ad?Other than that, I like the quality of pictures and ease of use, especially the 24mm equivalent wide angle. But, like I said, I bought this particular camera for WiFi printing. I was mislead.

Reviews.Title: This is a digital box camera-there is no aperture or shutter control possible!
Reviews.Author: Roky
Reviews.Content: This is a digital box camera as there is no aperture or shutter control possible! It reminds me of the boxcamera I had in 1960. Furthermore if there is a lot of light the camera will increase the shutter speed, so you may be shooting at F3 and 1/1,000 second, which gives you the least depth of field, when most of the time you want the most depth of field. The camera comes with a digital manual on the CD rom that is 175 pages long. Guess what? There is no mention of the words,"depth of field" anywhere in that manual. Leaving out shutter/aperture control is a management decision as this camera has enough computing power that you can program it to recognize a particular individuals face. So if depth of field control is not important to you this camera may suit you.

Reviews.Title: One of the hardest camera's to operate I've seen...
Reviews.Author: Printed Page "Printed Page"
Reviews.Content: Not user-friendly at all!  If you're a consumer who just wants to take simple videos and photos, this is NOT the camera for you.  The instruction booklet is almost useless except to define the parts.  I don't get the popularity of this product ... there are better ones out there in this price range.  The output quality is nothing to write home about either.

Reviews.Title: Slow and badly advertised
Reviews.Author: marianne silvestre
Reviews.Content: Did not like this camera. Takes pics too slowly and doesn't have wifi-got caught in that stupid advertising trick between wifi and wifi enabled or whatever the phrase is. Anyway, I can't directly upload pictures to the internet  which was the whole point on getting this stupid camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible instructions
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: could never get it to connect to wifi like it is supposed to.... my husband also tried to set it up and ran into the same problem, same place when he tried. Exceptionally poor instructions. Gave it one star cauase I bet it takes nice pics... a little bigger than the Elph 300

Reviews.Title: E32 error and shuts down immediately, the camera is damaged
Reviews.Author: David Richardson Santana
Reviews.Content: E32 error and shuts down immediately, It has an error, it's the only thing that makes this camera, the camera is damaged, maybe that's the reason the cost U.S. $119, the camera turns off by itself,  the packaging of the camera is very bad and that may be why it does not work properly, I saw several videos and this camera has much problems, in my case i do not recommend to buy this camera because you will suffer greatly and lose your money as it happened to me.

Reviews.Title: Great photos, takes a beating
Reviews.Author: chalky
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed this camera for over a year now and I drop it, throw it in a backpack and leave it around places on a regular basis. It takes great photos has a number of fun effects to apply to photos and is easy to hook up to a computer and download photos and videos. The camera cost about $199 and doesn't include the memory card which is a must. I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Camera not same as  same one purchased prior.
Reviews.Author: Anne Day
Reviews.Content: I had one of these camera purchased 2 years ago and loved it but because problem with battery compartment closer wanted to buy this same camera as a replacement. Was so disappointed in the  light weight and cheapness of  the product and returned it.

Reviews.Title: no memory card
Reviews.Author: Thomas L. Holwager
Reviews.Content: you would think that they could have included a memory card.  Couldn't take pics until i got a memory card

Reviews.Title: My phone cam is better
Reviews.Author: Chocobo Sandwich
Reviews.Content: I wanted something better than my note 2 phone camera. All the shots I got from the canon were mostly blurry and throwable. It has slightly less noise for indoor shots compared to my phone, but that's about it.  Ideo also looks terrible, and things get ugly when you zoom. It is also very hard to hold since it is small. Image preview is archaic and the resolution really sucks. Subpar lcd. I know its only for a quick preview, but why am I downgrading so much from my better phone camera with far better screen and everything else? If you are gonna say something stupid like oh i didn't adjust manual controls properly or held the camera still, this is a POINT AND SHOOT and should function as such. I am not oblivious to photography and even with the proper setup and patience, the images arent that much better. When you finally say effff it I'm gonna just POINT AND SHOOT, my camera phone pummels this blurry poorly exposed mess. The wifi setup is so convoluted and unrewarding i dont know why I bothered getting it to work when its just so glorified and clunky image uploaded to my phone. I'd rather just take it on my phone than, and enjoy it on a great looking large screen I can pinch yo zoom, pan around, edit, and darn share.

Reviews.Title: It does not record voice. Light weight good. Performance below my expectations.
Reviews.Author: Yacob
Reviews.Content: It does not record voice. Light weight good. Performance below my expectations. Instructions on the camera not sufficient. Poor performance in less light

Reviews.Title: Warning - too difficult to operate
Reviews.Author: Mark H. Kolman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for fast shutter speed and the wifi capability.  When I tried to use it, the shutter speed was slower than the previous model.  The only way I could get it to perform continuous shooting was to pay $23 to an online service to send me instructions that were still very difficult to follow to set it up for continuous.  There appears to be no online support from Canon, so unless you have an advanced degree from MIT, you may want to find a camera that is easier to operate

Reviews.Title: weird 3 beeps when i try to record
Reviews.Author: Estefania Medina
Reviews.Content: Okay so i love this camera but the record setting keeps making these weird 3 beep sounds and doesn't record, my memory card is empty and the camera is fully charged. Honestly wtf. I bought this camera specifically for vlogging.

Reviews.Title: WHETHER you call it the ELPH 330 or IXUS 240 - disappointing.
Reviews.Author: A. Tay "Private Tay"
Reviews.Content: TOUCH-screen: doesn't work wellI got this for the touch-focus, which seems to work okMy quibble is the touch-screen meniI like spot-metering but each time the camera comes on, I have to switch from evalutative (apparently, that's the default metering mode)Trouble is, the metering mode is at the top of the row of iconsAnd as I touch-screen my way to the metering mode, I seem to always end up re-setting something I didn't mean toAnd because the touch-screen's not that well-made, it takes quite a while to get to the settings that I wantI can't say how this touch-screen compares to smartphones - I don't use touch-screen phonesThe other problem is the lensAt the widest angle of view, the maximum f\stop is 2.7When I shoot after dark without flash, the shutter speed is always more than a second - impossible to handhold(Because the shutter speed can't be controlled manually, I'm entirely at the camera's mercy)The Ricoh PX I use - costs a lot less - has a maximum aperture of f\3.9That's almost one stop slowerBut somehow, with the PX, shutter speeds vary from 1\5 to 1\7 - which is tricky but possible to handholdI'm sure that in daylight, the camera works fineJust as long as you don't want to change settings

Reviews.Title: Don't get this if you have Windows 7 (64 bit)
Reviews.Author: PContino
Reviews.Content: Software to link camera to your computer will not work. I generated error message which Canon tech support inaccurately attributed to Microsoft. I had no luck with linking the camera to my computer and eventually gave up and returned the product. It smells like Canon rushed this out to meet a production deadline rather than to deliver a product that will meet consumer needs. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: need full disclosure
Reviews.Author: Ursula Jones
Reviews.Content: as soon as i got the camera, I charged the battery and couldn't wait to take pictures - to my great disappointment, the camera did not include a memory card! This should have been explicitly stated in the product description; actually, it should have been part of the camera. My Canon Cybershot came with a card.Now it is useless, because I live in a remote little town with no place to buy this item.

ProductInfo.Features:
Built-in Wi-Fi technology allows you to wirelessly transfer your images to social networking sites through CANON iMAGE GATEWAY
Upload virtually anywhere on your iOS or Android device with free download of the Canon Camera Window app
Capture beautiful 1080p full HD video in stereo sound with a dedicated movie button, zoom while shooting and play back videos on an HDTV via the HDMI output
12.1 megapixel CMOS sensor, DIGIC 5 processor, 10x optical image stabilized zoom and 24mm wide-angle lens
ECO Mode reduces power consumption so you can shoot longer on a single charge
ProductInfo.Name: Canon PowerShot ELPH 330 12MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3-Inch LCD (Silver)
